description: The Boston Red Sox will give Nathan Eovaldi the ball in Game 6 of the American League Championship Series against the Houston Astros on Friday night.

description: Chris Taylor always seems to come through when the Los Angeles Dodgers need him the most.

title: Braves blast 4 HRs, beat Dodgers 9-2 for 3-1 lead in NLCS
description: Eddie Rosario homered twice in his second four-hit game of the series and six pitchers combined on a four-hitter, giving the Atlanta Braves a 9-2 victory Wednesday night over the Los Angeles Dodgers and a commanding 3-1 lead in the NL Championship Series.

description: Framber Valdez was perfect through four, took a two-hit shutout into the seventh and became the first pitcher in the 2021 postseason to finish eight innings on Wednesday as the Houston Astros beat Boston 9-1 in Game 5 of the AL Championship Series and moved one win from a second straight trip to the World Series.

title: Alex Rodriguez trolled by Red Sox fans who chanted Jennifer Lopez's name at him
description: Alex Rodriguez was mocked at the MLB playoffs game by Red Sox fans who chanted the name of his ex-fiancee at him.

title: Braves again blow their chance for 3-0 NLCS lead on Dodgers
description: Luke Jackson threw the pitch he wanted in the exact location he wanted it, and Cody Bellinger still hammered that above-the-letters fastball deep into the frenzied right field stands at Dodger Stadium for a tying three-run homer in Game 3 of the NL Championship Series.

title: Survivors of Texas plane crash were headed to Astros game in Boston: 'shaky and shocked'
description: The survivors of the plane crash in Texas on Tuesday were headed to an Astros game in Boston and recounted feeling “shaky and shocked” following the crash.

title: Astros awaken for 7 in 9th, beat Boston 9-2 to tie ALCS 2-2

During one especially humdrum road game at the Rays' Tropicana Field, coach Jason Varitek suggested they needed to put some fun back into the game.

Martinez hit a tiebreaking, three-run homer in his return to the lineup and the Boston Red Sox backed Tanner Houck’s clutch relief effort with a franchise postseason record five home runs, beating the Tampa Bay Rays 14-6 Friday night to even their AL Division Series at a game each.

description: The San Francisco Giants couldn't celebrate a division title yet — not with the rival Dodgers still going win for win in the NL West race.

title: Matz sharp, Jays beat Orioles 6-4 to stay in wild card race
description: Steven Matz pitched seven solid innings to win his fifth straight decision, Danny Jansen homered and drove in three runs, and the Toronto Blue Jays kept their playoff hopes alive by beating the Baltimore Orioles 6-4 Friday night.

title: Red Sox beat Nats, move into 2nd spot in AL wild-card chase
description: Staggered down the stretch in their push for a postseason spot, the Boston Red Sox used two mighty punches to gain ground in the AL playoff chase.

title: Yanks' rally fizzles, AL wild-card race tightens as Rays win
description: Gary Sánchez and Rougned Odor both struck out with two runners on to blunt a ninth-inning rally and the New York Yankees’ lead atop the AL wild-card race got even tighter with a 4-3 loss to the Tampa Bay Rays on Friday night.

title: Astros' edge for home field in playoffs cut with loss to A's
description: Matt Olson and Chad Pinder each homered and the Oakland Athletics beat Houston 8-6 Friday night, cutting the Astros’ edge for home-field advantage in the AL playoffs.

title: Goldschmidt walk-off hit, O'Neill 2 HRs as Cards beat Cubs
description: Paul Goldschmidt hit a walk-off RBI single in the ninth inning, and the playoff-bound St. Louis Cardinals won for the 19th time in their last 20 games, 4-3 over the Chicago Cubs on Friday night.

title: Lynn, Abreu lift White Sox over Tigers for 5th straight win
description: Lance Lynn pitched one-run ball over five innings, José Abreu homered and drove in four runs, and the Chicago White Sox beat the Detroit Tigers 8-1 Friday night for their fifth straight win.

title: Harper homers, Suárez shuts down Marlins in Phils' 5-0 win
description: Bryce Harper had three hits including his 35th homer, Ranger Suárez pitched seven scoreless innings, and the Philadelphia Phillies beat the Miami Marlins 5-0 on Friday night.

title: Nimmo 2 HRs, leads Megill, Mets over Braves 4-3
description: Brandon Nimmo hit two solo home runs, Tylor Megill allowed one hit in five scoreless innings and the New York Mets beat the Atlanta Braves 4-3 on Friday night, snapping the NL East champions’ six-game winning streak.

title: Back-to-back homers again carry Dodgers past Padres 8-3
description: Dave Roberts rushed into his office after the Dodgers' victory and turned on the TV. He caught a familiar sight — the rival Giants winning again.

title: Wade, Giants beat D-backs in 9th, hold 2-game NL West edge
description: “Late Night LaMonte" finally delivered at home for San Francisco on Thursday night.

title: World Series Odds: How markets are moving as playoff race heats up
description: Booking Major League Baseball future bets can be quite the balancing act during the final week of the regular season.

title: Iowa 'Field of Dreams' site purchased by group helmed by Hall of Famer Frank Thomas
description: Frank Thomas was at the "Field of Dreams" movie site in Dyersville, Iowa, Thursday to declare he and his business partners purchased a controlling interest in the site's ownership.

title: Judge HRs twice, Yankees beat Jays 6-2 to extend WC lead
description: Aaron Judge hit two of New York's five home runs and the Yankees extended their AL wild-card lead by beating the Toronto Blue Jays 6-2 Thursday night.

title: Correa, Astros clinch AL West, open playoffs vs White Sox
description: Carlos Correa hit his career-high 25th homer with a three-run shot and the Houston Astros clinched the AL West with a 3-2 win over the Tampa Bay Rays on Thursday night.

title: Braves beat Phils for 4th straight NL East title
description: Ian Anderson turned in another dominant pitching performance, Jorge Soler and Austin Riley homered, and the Atlanta Braves clinched their fourth straight NL East title by completing a sweep of the Philadelphia Phillies with a 5-3 victory Thursday night.

title: Red Sox lose to Orioles again, tied for second AL wild card
description: The Boston Red Sox were dealt another blow in their postseason push by last-place Baltimore, with Ryan Mountcastle hitting a three-run homer in the third inning of the Orioles' 6-2 win Thursday night.

title: Garcia sets rookie HR record in 7-6 Rangers win over Angels
description: Adolis Garcia has been a bright spot throughout a 100-loss season for the Texas Rangers. After a long wait, the Cuban outfielder broke a pair of longstanding rookie records with one big swing.

title: Cat scurries along beam in upper deck before Braves-Phillies
description: A small cat scurried through the rafters at Truist Park before the Atlanta Braves tried to clinch their fourth straight NL East title against the Philadelphia Phillies on Thursday night.

title: Police identify victims in Petco Park deaths; attorney says family intends to file wrongful death suit
description: Police in California have identified the woman and child that fell to their deaths during a San Diego Padres game over the weekend, and now an attorney representing the family says they plan to sue.

title: Rookie Carlson homers twice, Cardinals beat Brewers 4-3
description: Rookie Dylan Carlson homered twice, once from each side of the plate, and the St. Louis Cardinals beat the Milwaukee Brewers 4-3 on Thursday.

title: Quick hook: MLB's 200-inning club becomes even smaller
description: Los Angeles Dodgers right-hander Walker Buehler has a lot of pride in reaching 200 innings pitched this season, especially considering he's battled injuries through parts of his career, including Tommy John surgery.

title: David Ortiz shooting suspect killed in Dominican Republic: reports
description: A suspect in the David Ortiz shooting from 2019 was reportedly shot and killed in Puerto Rico over the weekend.

title: Frank Thomas heads group that buys Field of Dreams site
description: Frank Thomas has found his Field of Dreams.

title: Pedro Martinez blasts umpires after allegedly missing balk
description: Pedro Martinez’s competitive fire still shows even 12 years after he pitched in his final Major League Baseball game as a member of the Philadelphia Phillies.

title: Bichette homers twice, Blue Jays top Yanks 6-5, tighten race
description: Bo Bichette homered twice, including a tiebreaking drive in the eighth inning that lifted the Toronto Blue Jays over the Yankees 6-5 Wednesday night, tightened the AL wild-card race and ended New York’s seven-game winning streak.

title: Dodgers slam 4 HRs in 8th for 11-9 comeback win over Padres
description: The Dodgers still have a heartbeat in the NL West race, and it was throbbing late in the game.

title: Contending Mariners win for 10th time in 11 games; A's out
description: Jarred Kelenic stood outside the Seattle Mariners dugout with the crowd roaring and holding a placard with a phrase borrowed from a popular television show.

title: Bryant's sacrifice fly lifts Giants to win No 104
description: Alex Wood and three relievers combined for a four-hitter for San Francisco, Kris Bryant hit a sacrifice fly and the Giants reached 104 wins for the first time since 1905 by beating the woeful Arizona Diamondbacks 1-0 Wednesday night.

title: Martinez helps Red Sox end slide with 6-0 win over Orioles
description: The Boston Red Sox finally put it all together, and it didn't matter one bit that this very important victory came at the expense of the last-place Baltimore Orioles.

title: Rays clinch top seed in AL playoffs, stall Astros in West
description: After locking down the top seed in the American League playoffs and the best record in franchise history, the Tampa Bay Rays were still looking for more.

title: Ohtani done on mound in his standout 2-way season for Angels
description: Shohei Ohtani has thrown his final pitch this season for the Los Angeles Angels, and the two-way All-Star will focus on his at-bats in the final few games.

title: White Sox SS Tim Anderson suspended for contact with umpire
description: White Sox shortstop Tim Anderson has been suspended for three games and fined for making contact with umpire Tim Timmons during Monday's 8-7 win at Detroit.

title: Rodón returns as White Sox beat Reds for 4th straight win
description: Carlos Rodón made the most of the stuff he had. That was enough for manager Tony La Russa.

title: Cards' 17-game winning streak ends with 4-0 loss to Brewers
description: St. Louis manager Mike Shildt was philosophical after the Cardinals' team-record 17-game winning streak came to an end.

title: Fried, Riley power Braves past Phils; magic number down to 1
description: With the Braves closing in on a division title, Max Fried wanted to pick up where Charlie Morton left off the night before.

title: GOP rep hits out-of-the-park home run in Congressional Baseball Game
description: If the congressional gig doesn’t work out, the Washington Nationals may be able to use Rep. Greg Steube.

title: Brewers' Devin Williams breaks throwing hand after punching wall, will miss playoffs
description: Milwaukee Brewers reliever Devin Williams’ season is likely over.

title: Cardinals win 17th straight, clinch 2nd NL wild card spot
description: Nolan Arenado came to the St. Louis Cardinals expecting to play into October.

title: Congressional Baseball Game means something extra to Steve Scalise, 4 years after shooting
description: House Minority Whip Steve Scalise said the Congressional Baseball Game for Charity at Nationals Park is a little extra special to him, in an interview with Fox News at the final practice before the big game.

title: Giants earn 103rd win to tie third-most wins in team history
description: The San Francisco Giants keep finding ways to win key games as more players go down injured, still chasing a coveted NL West crown.

title: Buehler earns career-high 15th win, Dodgers beat Padres 2-1
description: The Los Angeles Dodgers need to win the week to catch NL West-leading San Francisco, and even that might not be enough.

title: Haniger's homer helps M's beat A's 4-2, close in wild card
description: Mitch Haniger hit his 100th home run and third in two games, and the Seattle Mariners pulled within a half-game of the second AL wild card berth by beating the Oakland Athletics 4-2 on Tuesday night.

title: Maddon: Shohei Ohtani didn't say he wants to leave Angels
description: Los Angeles Angels manager Joe Maddon said Tuesday that Shohei Ohtani's comments last weekend about wanting to win don't mean the two-way star wants to leave the organization when he becomes a free agent after the 2023 season.

title: Lindor, Stroman lead Mets past Marlins 5-2 in DH opener
description: Francisco Lindor homered and drove in three runs, Marcus Stroman earned his 10th win and the New York Mets stopped a five-game losing streak with a 5-2 victory over the Miami Marlins in the opener of their doubleheader Tuesday.

title: Bradley Zimmer smokes homer off of his brother, Kyle Zimmer
description: Cleveland Indians outfielder Bradley Zimmer said he felt “mixed emotions” after he hit a home run off his older brother, Kansas City Royals pitcher Kyle Zimmer.

title: White Sox hold off Tigers with 8-7 win after benches clear
description: Eloy Jiménez hit a two-run home run, Yasmani Grandal homered to spark a six-run fourth inning and the AL Central champion Chicago White Sox held off the Detroit Tigers in a testy 8-7 win on Monday.

title: Haniger hits 2 HRs, M's beat A's to gain in wild-card race
description: Mitch Haniger hit two identical three-run homers and the Seattle Mariners gained precious ground in the AL wild-card race with a 13-4 win over the Oakland Athletics on Monday night.

title: Petco Park deaths: Witness says mom lost balance after jumping up on bench with child
description: A witness to the tragic fall that left a mom and toddler dead at San Diego's Petco Park over the weekend, says the mother appeared to lose her balance after jumping up on a bench near an upper-level railing, according to a report.

title: Shohei Ohtani casts doubt on Angels future: 'I want to win'
description: Los Angeles Angels star Shohei Ohtani made it clear that winning is the most important thing to him.

title: White Sox, Tigers get into heated skirmish during game
description: The Chicago White Sox and Detroit Tigers were involved in a heated skirmish in the ninth inning of their afternoon matchup on Monday.

title: Votto helps Reds beat Pirates 13-1 to stay in playoff race
description: Joey Votto homered twice and drove in four runs, and the Cincinnati Reds pounded the Pittsburgh Pirates 13-1 on Wednesday to stay alive in the race for the second NL wild card.

title: Depth shows up for Cardinals during 16-game win streak
description: It's Paul Goldschmidt, Adam Wainwright, Yadier Molina and Nolan Arenado. But it's also Giovanny Gallegos, Andrew Knizner, Jake Woodford and Kodi Whitley.

title: Indians beat Royals in last home game before name change
description: The Cleveland Indians won their last home game before becoming the Guardians, beating the Kansas City Royals 8-3 on Monday to close a run that started in 1915 and will continue next season with a new identity.

title: Hot Harper carries Phillies into NL East title contention
description: Bryce Harper waited for the “MVP!” chants to fade as he stepped to the microphone at the Phillies' home finale to thank fans for sticking by them in the pennant race.

title: Umpire provides explanation for wild play in Cardinals-Cubs
description: Umpire Bill Miller provided an explanation Monday for a wild sequence during St. Louis' 4-2 victory over the Chicago Cubs that added another layer of drama to the Cardinals' 16th straight win.

title: Braves, Phillies to go head to head with division in balance
description: The Atlanta Braves and Philadelphia Phillies are in an old-fashioned battle for the NL East title, with the wild card looking unlikely for whoever finishes second.

title: Petco Park deaths 'appeared to be suspicious,' police say
description: A horrific incident at Petco Park over the weekend was being described by police as “suspicious” as the San Diego Padres played their final home game of the season Sunday.

title: Yankees top Red Sox after controversial 8th inning, take over wild-card lead
description: The New York Yankees used a controversial eighth inning to gain new life and defeat the Boston Red Sox on Sunday, 6-3, as the season nears its end and the American League wild-card race gets hotter.

title: A's edge AL West-leading Astros again on walk-off hit in 9th
description: Mark Canha hit an RBI single with one out in the bottom of the ninth inning and the Oakland Athletics again beat Houston with their final swing, edging the AL West-leading Astros 4-3 Sunday.

title: Cardinals get hot at crucial time with MLB postseason looming
description: The St. Louis Cardinals got hot at the right time and enter their second-to-last series of the 2021 season on a 16-game winning streak in good position to clinch the second National League wild card spot.

title: Brewers clinch NL Central, condemn Mets to losing record
description: The Milwaukee Brewers clinched their second NL Central title in four years, beating the sloppy New York Mets 8-4 Sunday behind Willy Adames's two-run homer and three RBIs.

title: Seager 2 HRs, Urías, Dodgers win 100th, keep pace in NL West
description: Corey Seager hit two solo homers, Julio Urías posted his MLB-leading 19th victory and the Los Angeles Dodgers won their 100th game of the season by beating the Arizona Diamondbacks 3-0 on Sunday.

title: Ohtani not enough, Mariners send Angels to losing season
description: Shohei Ohtani wasn't enough to keep the Los Angeles Angeles from their sixth straight losing season.

title: Giants hold NL West lead, top Rockies; Belt's hand injured
description: Brandon Crawford homered to cap a four-run ninth inning and the San Francisco Giants held their lead in the NL West, beating the Colorado Rockies 6-2 on Sunday.

title: Reds rout Nationals 9-2 to keep slim playoff hopes alive
description: Tyler Stephenson and Nick Castellanos hit consecutive home runs, Kyle Farmer broke open the game with a grand slam and the Cincinnati Reds kept alive their slim playoff hopes by routing the Washington Nationals 9-2 Sunday.

title: Jansen, Springer homer, Blue Jays beat Twins, keep pressure
description: Danny Jansen hit a go-ahead, three-run homer, George Springer also went deep and the Blue Jays beat the Minnesota Twins 5-2 Sunday to maintain pressure in the AL wild-card race before heading to Toronto for their final homestand.

title: Giolito's 6 scoreless innings leads White Sox past Indians
description: Lucas Giolito pitched six scoreless innings, Eloy Jiménez had a two-run single and the AL Central champion Chicago White Sox defeated the Cleveland Indians 5-2 on Sunday.

title: Phils' 5-game win streak ended by Pirates; Atlanta on deck
description: Phillies starter Hans Crouse gave up a home run to Cole Tucker on his first major league pitch and Philadelphia’s playoff hopes took a hit Sunday with a 6-0 loss to Max Kranick and the Pittsburgh Pirates.

title: Baz's 5 2/3 scoreless innings helps Rays sweep Marlins 3-2
description: Rookie Shane Baz pitched 5 2/3 scoreless innings to win his second straight start and the AL East champion Tampa Bay Rays beat the Miami Marlins 3-2 Sunday for their team-record 14th series sweep.

title: Belt homers twice, Giants top Rockies to boost NL West lead
description: Brandon Belt wasn't thinking too deep about his team's looming home run record.

title: Ohtani hits consecutive triples, Angels rout Mariners 14-1
description: Shohei Ohtani tripled in his first two at-bats and the Los Angeles Angels routed Seattle 14-1 on Saturday night, ending the Mariners’ six-game winning streak and damaging their playoff chances.

title: Blue Jays beat Twins 6-1; stay 2 back in AL wild-card race
description: Teoscar Hernández, Marcus Semien and George Springer homered, and the Toronto Blue Jays held their position in the playoff chase by beating the Minnesota Twins 6-1 Saturday night.

title: Brewers on brink of NL Central title after Burnes beats Mets
description: Corbin Burnes pitched seven brilliant innings to win his ninth consecutive decision and the Milwaukee Brewers moved to the brink of clinching the NL Central title with a 2-1 victory over the New York Mets on Saturday night.

title: Gallen, Marte help Diamondbacks slow down Dodgers, 7-2
description: Ketel Marte and Carson Kelly homered early off Clayton Kershaw, Zac Gallen pitched one-run ball for six innings and the Arizona Diamondbacks kept the Los Angeles Dodgers from reaching 100 wins by beating them 7-2 on Saturday night.

title: Castellanos solo homer in 9th lifts Reds over Nationals 7-6
description: Nick Castellanos hit a solo home run with one out in the ninth inning and the Cincinnati Reds beat the Washington Nationals 7-6 on Saturday night.

title: Soler, Braves win 10-8 in 10 innings to eliminate Padres
description: Jorge Soler hit a go-ahead double with one out in the 10th inning for his fourth RBI, and the Atlanta Braves won 10-8 on Saturday night to keep their 1 1/2-game lead in the NL East while eliminating the San Diego Padres from playoff contention.

title: Woman, child fall to their deaths at Petco Park before Padres game: 'It’s a horrible, horrible thing'
description: A horrifying moment occurred before the start of the San Diego Padres’ game against the Atlanta Braves at Petco Park on Saturday night.

title: Morgan allows 1 hit in 6 innings, Indians beat White Sox 6-0
description: Eli Morgan allowed one hit in six innings and José Ramirez drove in three runs, powering the Cleveland Indians to a 6-0 victory over the AL Central champion Chicago White Sox on Saturday night.

title: Cardinals set team record with 15th straight win, beat Cubs
description: Harrison Bader and the St. Louis Cardinals clearly recognize their record is impressive. Now they also want to win their next game — and many more after that.

title: Rays clinch 2nd straight AL East title, beat Marlins 7-3
description: The Tampa Bay Rays clinched their second straight AL East title, with Mike Zunino hitting a go-ahead homer and Brandon Lowe later adding a pair of RBI doubles to beat the Miami Marlins 7-3 on Saturday night.

title: Giancarlo Stanton hits go-ahead grand slam in the eighth, Yankees win 5-3 against Red Sox
description: Giancarlo Stanton followed a strong performance on Friday night against the Red Sox by creating a definitive moment in New York’s season — should it end memorably for the Yanks. Stanton went 3-for-5 and added his 32nd home run of the season on Friday.

title: Marte's double in 9th lifts A's 2-1, stalls Astros
description: Starling Marte hit a game-ending double with one out in the bottom of the ninth inning, lifting the Oakland Athletics past the Houston Astros 2-1 on Saturday.

title: Suarez shutout, Harper HR, Phils win 5th in row, top Pirates
description: Ranger Suarez has done a little bit of everything this season for the Philadelphia Phillies. Right now, he’s keeping them in the playoff race.

title: Angels star Trout makes it official: He's out for the season
description: Los Angeles Angels star Mike Trout is officially shut down for the season.

title: Fried brilliant in 3-hitter, Braves silence Padres 4-0
description: Max Fried was absolutely brilliant at just the right time for the Atlanta Braves.

title: Montas reaches 200 Ks, A's pound first-place Astros 14-2
description: Frankie Montas pitched two-hit ball over seven innings and became the first Oakland pitcher in 20 years to reach 200 strikeouts in a season, helping the Athletics pound the Houston Astros 14-2 on Friday night to support their slim playoff hopes.

title: Mariners walk Ohtani in 9th, hold off Angels to keep pace
description: Ty France homered, Jake Fraley scored the go-ahead run on a throwing error and the streaking Seattle Mariners held off the Los Angeles Angels 6-5 Friday night to keep pace in the AL wild-card chase.

title: Cole, Stanton lead Yankees past Red Sox 8-3, cut lead to 1
description: Gerrit Cole showed the Yankees he’s ready for the important games soon to come. Nathan Eovaldi left the Red Sox with nothing but worries.

title: Gregorius' HR rallies Phillies, cuts Braves' NL East lead
description: Didi Gregorius hit a go-ahead, three-run home run in the seventh inning, Bryce Harper had an RBI double and the Philadelphia Phillies pulled closer to first place in the NL East with an 8-6 victory over the Pittsburgh Pirates on Friday night.

title: Cards match record with 14th straight win, rip Cubs 12-4
description: The surging St. Louis Cardinals emphatically matched a team record with their 14th straight win on Friday night, pounding the Chicago Cubs 12-4 in the second game of a doubleheader behind Tyler O’Neill’s three-run homer and a pair of solo shots by Lars Nootbaar.

title: Dodgers beat Diamondbacks 4-2, keep pace in NL West race
description: Tony Gonsolin's second pitch of the game was smoked by Arizona's Josh Rojas before Los Angeles left fielder A.J. Pollock robbed a potential extra-base hit, leaping at the warning track to snag the line drive.

title: Reds beat Nationals 8-7 in 11 but fall further behind Cards
description: Aristides Aquino drove in TJ Friedl with a game-ending single off the glove of second baseman Luis Garcia, and the Cincinnati Reds beat the Washington Nationals 8-7 in 11 innings Friday night.

title: Giants top Rockies 7-2 for 100th win, hold onto NL West lead
description: The San Francisco Giants reached one milestone and are close to another in their resurgent season. The real goal is another World Series title.

title: Brewers hit 3 HRs, get strong outing from Lauer to down Mets
description: Christian Yelich hit one of Milwaukee's three home runs and Eric Lauer turned in a much-needed strong start for the Brewers in their 5-1 win over the New York Mets on Friday night.

title: Buxton's homer spoils Berríos’ return; Twins beat Jays 3-1
description: Byron Buxton’s two-run homer spoiled José Berríos’ return to Minnesota and dealt a blow to Toronto’s postseason hopes as the Twins beat the Blue Jays 3-1 on Friday night.

title: Cease hit on arm by comebacker, White Sox top Indians 1-0
description: Chicago starter Dylan Cease left after being struck on the right arm by a comebacker in the sixth inning as the White Sox beat Cleveland 1-0 on Friday night in Indians ace Shane Bieber's return.

title: Yarbrough goes 6 strong in relief, Rays beat Marlins 8-0
description: Ryan Yarbrough allowed two hits over six innings of splendid relief and the Tampa Bay Rays beat the Miami Marlins 8-0 on Friday night to close in on another AL East title.

title: A's Chris Bassitt explains why he returned to mound after scary facial injury: 'We are the green and gold'
description: Oakland Athletics pitcher Chris Bassitt returned to the mound Thursday to play the Seattle Mariners a month after he suffered facial fractures when he got drilled with a line drive.

title: Ohtani bounces back with go-ahead run as Angels edge Astros
description: This time, the calls went Shohei Ohtani's way.

title: Cleveland set to say goodbye to Indians for good
description: There's no more debate or decisions forthcoming. There's still some anger and disbelief, but also the excitement that comes along with change.

title: Twins bump Blue Jays back in wild card race, as Gurriel hurt
description: The Toronto Blue Jays were relieved when surging left fielder Lourdes Gurriel Jr. escaped a freak play in the outfield without serious injury.

title: Phillies rally from 6 down, beat Bucs 12-6 to gain on Braves
description: J.T. Realmuto homered and drove in four, Ronald Torreyes hit a go-ahead, three-run home run in the sixth inning and the Philadelphia Phillies erased a six-run deficit to beat the Pittsburgh Pirates 12-6 Thursday night and pick up ground in the NL East.

title: Soto homers twice, boosts average to .325, Nats beat Reds
description: National League batting leader Juan Soto homered in consecutive innings, and the Washington Nationals pushed the Cincinnati Reds further from playoff contention with a 3-2 win Thursday night in the opener of a four-game series.

title: Caratini, Padres beat Giants 7-6 in 10 to tighten NL West
description: The San Diego Padres can have a say over the NL West race even as they appear headed toward what would be the biggest collapse in franchise history.

title: Muncy homers in 10th, Dodgers rally for 7-5 win over Rockies
description: The ever-reliable Max Scherzer just couldn't get his usual grip on the baseball in the thin air at Coors Field. He licked his hand. He held the ball tighter. But nothing seemed to work.

title: Blue Jays' Borucki suspended 3 games for plunking Kiermaier
description: Toronto Blue Jays reliever Ryan Borucki has been suspended for three games by Major League Baseball for intentionally hitting Tampa Bay's Kevin Kiermaier with a pitch in the latest salvo in a spat between the two AL East competitors.

title: Bassitt returns but Mariners beat A’s 6-5 for 4-game sweep
description: Chris Bassitt pitched three scoreless innings less than a month after surgery to repair facial fractures, but the Seattle Mariners rallied against Oakland's bullpen for a 6-5 victory Thursday and a four-game sweep that damaged the Athletics' wild-card hopes.

title: Kelly, lowly D-Backs rally past NL East-leading Braves 6-4
description: Carson Kelly hit a tying three-run homer in a five-run seventh inning, Daulton Varsho followed with a go-ahead double and the last-place Arizona Diamondbacks beat the NL East-leading Atlanta Braves 6-4 Thursday.

title: Ex-MLB star Darryl Strawberry's granddaughter found safe after he asked social media for help
description: The granddaughter of former New York Mets slugger Darryl Strawberry was found safe after he and his daughter, Diamond, pleaded for help finding the teenager in the Nevada area.

title: Dodgers' Brusdar Graterol showcases his nasty pitching vs. Rockies
description: Los Angeles Dodgers reliever Brusdar Graterol has some of the nastiest stuff in baseball, and it was showcased Wednesday night against the Colorado Rockies.

title: Goldschmidt homers twice, Cards beat Brewers for 12th in row
description: Paul Goldschmidt homered twice, and the St. Louis Cardinals overcame a five-run deficit to beat the Milwaukee Brewers 8-5 Thursday and extend their longest winning streak in 39 years to 12 games.

title: White Sox clinch AL Central title for first time in 13 years
description: The Chicago White Sox became the first team to clinch a division title for the 2021 season.

title: Bryce Harper is the NL MVP after 'unbelievable' turnaround, Baseball Hall of Famer says
description: Bryce Harper’s contract is finally paying out for the Philadelphia Phillies in his third season with the team.

title: GOP Senate candidate says he offered $1B for Cleveland Indians in bid to prevent name change
description: Blockchain executive-turned-Senate candidate Bernie Moreno made the offer to the Dolan family, which owns the team, but was turned down, he told Fox News in an exclusive interview on Wednesday.

title: Rays' Kevin Kiermaier wants Blue Jays in postseason after scouting-card controversy
description: On Monday, the Tampa Rays' Kevin Kiermaier picked up a scouting card off the ground that apparently came from Toronto Blue Jays catcher Alejandro Kirk during a play at the plate and refused to give it back.

title: Bryant, Posey lead Giants to 8-6 win over fading Friars
description: Scott Kazmir got the San Francisco Giants into a jam and rookie reliever Camilo Doval got them right out of it.

title: Astros move closer, beat Angels in 12; Ohtani out at plate
description: Houston manager Dusty Baker says a huge source of pride about his AL West-leading team is the way it plays defense.

title: Dodgers fall 2 games back in NL West, lose to Rockies 10-5
description: First Julio Urías. Now Walker Buehler.

title: NL East-leading Braves overcome Duvall's lost HR in victory
description: Adam Duvall lost a home run to a baserunning miscue, but Atlanta rebounded with homers by Austin Riley, Ozzie Albies and Freddie Freeman and the Braves beat the Arizona Diamondbacks 9-2 on Wednesday night.

title: Seager, France HR, Mariners top A's, move up in playoff race
description: Seattle manager Scott Servais has said the Mariners might need a nice winning streak during the September stretch run to make a real postseason push.

title: Schwarber, Sale help Boston win 7th in a row, 12-5 over Mets
description: The red-hot Red Sox are rallying around their yellow jerseys, and even Chris Sale is on board.

title: Yanks sweep Texas, pass Blue Jays, roll into Fenway showdown
description: Gleyber Torres and the New York Yankees are rolling into a season-ending divisional gauntlet taking solace in the standings.

title: Cards win 11th in row, best streak since 2001; stall Brewers
description: Paul Goldschmidt and Tyler O’Neill homered as the St. Louis Cardinals won their 11th straight game, extending their lead for the second NL wild-card spot and beating the division-leading Milwaukee Brewers 10-2 Wednesday night.

title: Harper's throw to plate saves Phillies' 4-3 win over O's
description: Bryce Harper won games for the Phillies this year with one swing, one slide, one daring dash around the bases.

title: Reds manager Bell agrees to 2-year extension
description: The Cincinnati Reds and manager David Bell announced a two-year extension through of his contract through 2023.

title: Kiermaier hit, apparent retribution, as Rays clinch playoffs
description: Kevin Kiermaier was hit by a pitch, apparent retribution for scooping up a Toronto scouting report two days earlier, and the Tampa Bay Rays clinched a postseason berth with a 7-1 victory over the Blue Jays on Wednesday.

title: UFC's Conor McGregor throws awful first pitch at Cubs game: 'It's a little off'
description: Conor McGregor was asked to throw out the first pitch at the Chicago Cubs game on Tuesday night but after throwing a wild pitch way off target, the two-time UFC champion isn’t looking for any redos.

title: Rays' Cash apologizes after Kiermaier takes, keeps data card
description: Tampa Bay manager Kevin Cash apologized to Blue Jays management a day after Rays veteran Kevin Kiermaier scooped up a scouting data card that fell out of Toronto catcher Alejandro Kirk's wristband and refused to give it back.

title: Yankees power past Rangers 7-1 to keep pace in playoff race
description: After their biggest bats did plenty of damage, the New York Yankees auditioned a new bullpen weapon for the stretch drive: Luis Severino.

title: Bassitt to start for A's, 5 weeks after being hit in head
description: Athletics right-hander Chris Bassitt is set to return to the mound, just over five weeks after being hospitalized when he was hit in the head by a 100 mph line drive.

title: Mariners beat Athletics 5-2 to stay in AL wild-card chase
description: Marco Gonzales pitched six uneven innings and won his eighth straight decision, and the Seattle Mariners beat Oakland 5-2 on Tuesday night, moving into a tie with the Athletics in a matchup of wild-card contenders.

title: Ohtani hits 45th HR while surging Astros rout Angels 10-5
description: Shohei Ohtani's latest majestic homer wasn't nearly enough to turn back the Houston Astros as they steamroll toward another AL West title.

title: Pujols hit in 10th, Dodgers beat Rox, stay close in NL West
description: Pinch-hitter Albert Pujols drew on his vast baseball wisdom to get that clutch hit. Once he reached first base, he celebrated like a kid.

title: Cards win 10th in row, beat Brewers to extend wild-card lead
description: Cardinals closer Giovanny Gallegos fanned pinch-hitter Pablo Reyes with the bases loaded for the final out and St. Louis won its 10th straight game, increasing its lead in the playoff chase by holding off the division-leading Milwaukee Brewers 2-1 Tuesday night.

title: Grievance over shortened MLB season opens Monday
description: In the midst of difficult negotiations for a new collective bargaining agreement, Major League Baseball and its players' association are scheduled to start a grievance hearing next Monday over the union's claim the 2020 pandemic-affected season was too short.

title: Cody Bellinger placed on injured list with left rib fracture
description: The Los Angeles Dodgers placed outfielder Cody Bellinger on the injured list with a left rib fracture.

title: White Sox lose to Tigers, putting AL Central clinch on hold
description: Akil Baddoo and Victor Reyes drove in two runs apiece and the Detroit Tigers stalled the Chicago White Sox’s drive for the AL Central title with a 5-3 victory on Tuesday.

title: Jo Lasorda, widow of Los Angeles Dodgers manager, dies at 91
description: Jo Lasorda, the widow of Los Angeles Dodgers manager Tommy Lasorda, has died. She was 91.

title: Valdez, González, Maldonado send Astros past Angels 10-0
description: With a well-rested Framber Valdez on the mound turning in one of his best performances in an outstanding season, the Houston Astros really didn't need all the runs they racked up on a blowout night at the Big A.

title: Braves ride big 5th inning to win, extend NL East lead
description: Austin Riley was smacking baseballs all around Chase Field on Monday night. Adam Duvall hit one so hard it left the yard by a long, long way.

title: Seager's three RBIs help Mariners stop A's 5-game win streak
description: Kyle Seager had a two-run double in the decisive third inning among his three hits and three RBIs, Mitch Haniger added two doubles and the Seattle Mariners beat the Oakland Athletics 4-2 on Monday night.

title: Votto power surge leads Reds rally for 9-5 win over Pirates
description: Joey Votto tied the game with his second homer of the night, Eugenio Suarez followed with a go-ahead shot and the Cincinnati Reds rallied from a five-run deficit for a 9-5 win over the Pittsburgh Pirates on Monday.

title: Shane Baz wins MLB debut, Rays cut Blue Jays' wild-card lead
description: Shane Baz pitched two-hit ball for five innings to win his major league debut and the AL East-leading Tampa Bay Rays cut Toronto's lead in the wild-card chase, holding off the Blue Jays 6-4 on Monday night.

title: Marlins' Jesús Sánchez makes incredible barehanded catch vs. Nationals
description: Miami Marlins right fielder Jesús Sánchez made an incredible play in the fourth winning of a wild win on Monday night against the Washington Nationals.

title: Sánchez homers, Yanks beat Rangers 4-3 to gain in wild card
description: Gary Sánchez rebounded from poor defensive play with a go-ahead home run, four pitchers combined for scoreless relief and the New York Yankees gained in the AL wild-card race with a 4-3 victory over the Texas Rangers on Monday night.

title: Lester wins 200th, Cards down Brewers for ninth straight win
description: Jon Lester notched his 200th career win, Nolan Arenado hit a two-run homer and the St. Louis Cardinals beat the NL Central-leading Milwaukee Brewers 5-2 Monday night for their ninth consecutive win.

title: White Sox lose 4-3 to Tigers but close in on division crown
description: Carlos Rodón was pulled after three rocky innings and the Chicago White Sox, closing in on the AL Central title, squandered a three-run lead in a 4-3 loss to the Detroit Tigers on Monday night.

title: Phillies' NL East-chase hindered in 2-0 loss to 100-loss O's
description: John Means struck out six and stymied Bryce Harper and a Philadelphia Phillies team in an eleventh-hour playoff push to lead the Baltimore Orioles to a 2-0 win Monday night.

title: Former OF Gose flashes 100 mph heat for Indians, fans Perez
description: Formerly a fleet outfielder, Anthony Gose returned to the majors five years later Monday night as a rocket-armed reliever for the Cleveland Indians, flashing 100 mph heat and fanning Royals slugger Salvador Perez.

title: Royals' Salvador Perez, Patrick Mahomes react to record-setting homer: 'This is a dream come true'
description: Kansas City Royals star Salvador Perez broke Johnny Bench’s record for most home runs in a single season by a catcher on Monday against the Cleveland Indians.

title: Perez breaks Bench's record with 46th HR, KC tops Indians
description: Salvador Perez hit his 46th home run, breaking Johnny Bench’s record for homers by a catcher in a season, and the Kansas City Royals beat the Cleveland Indians 7-2 Monday in the first game of a doubleheader.

title: Mookie Betts makes nice bat-for-ball trade with fan
description: Reds rookie pinch-hitter TJ Friedl smoked a homer for his first big league hit yesterday and the mission to get the baseball was on.

title: Batting title races jumbled as MLB season winds down
description: The bar for the batting title is unusually low this year — and that's creating wild races for the honor in both leagues.

title: Yankees on outside looking in as season hits crucial point: 'We’ve got to do better than this'
description: The Yankees have had a rough September and need to get some wins to make the playoffs as the season winds down.

title: MLB teams' pursuit of the postseason comes down to final 2 weeks of season
description: There are two weeks remaining in the MLB regular season. and the American and National League divisional and wild-card races are hotly contested battles that might not be decided until Oct. 3.

title: McNeil's homer lifts Mets; Phillies slip in playoff race
description: Jeff McNeil hit a tiebreaking homer leading off the seventh inning, and the New York Mets beat Philadelphia 3-2 Sunday night, damaging the Phillies’ playoff hopes.

title: Ohtani strkes out 10, A's beat Angels 3-2, stay in WC race
description: Shohei Ohtani struck out 10 but went winless in consecutive starts on the mound for the first time since June, and the Oakland Athletics rebounded from a bullpen meltdown to beat the Los Angeles Angels 3-2 in 10 innings Sunday.

title: Rosario hits for cycle, leads Fried, Braves over Giants 3-0
description: Eddie Rosario became the second Atlanta player in a month to hit for the cycle, Max Fried pitched seven strong innings and the Braves beat the San Francisco Giants 3-0 Sunday in a matchup of division leaders.

title: Tatis botches popup, Cards beat Padres 8-7, win 8th straight
description: San Diego center fielder Fernando Tatis Jr. dropped Nolan Arenado’s bases-loaded popup and heaved the ball home, leading to a five-run first inning, and the St. Louis Cardinals beat the Padres 8-7 Sunday for an eight-game winning streak.

title: Wisdom sets Cubs rookie record with 27th HR, beat Brewers
description: Patrick Wisdom set a Chicago Cubs record for homers by a rookie on a day that exemplified his feast-or-famine approach.

title: Abreu, White Sox closer to AL Central title, beat Rangers
description: Lucas Giolito feels like the Chicago White Sox are right where they need to be as they close in on their first AL Central title since 2008.

title: Siri, McCormick rally AL West-leading Astros past D-backs
description: Jose Siri and Chas McCormick hit back-to-back home runs in the eighth inning, rallying the AL West-leading Houston Astros over the Arizona Diamondbacks 7-6 on Sunday.

title: Kelenic HR, 2 doubles lead Mariners over Royals 7-1
description: Rookie Jarred Kelenic homered, doubled twice and wrapped up his impressive series, leading the Seattle Mariners over the Kansas City Royals 7-1 on Sunday.

title: Tigers, Peralta slow AL-East leading Rays 2-0
description: Wily Peralta gave up three hits in seven innings, and Eric Haase and Dustin Garneau homered for the Detroit Tigers in a 2-0 win over the AL East-leading Tampa Bay Rays on Sunday.

title: AL wild-card leading Red Sox rally past O's 8-6
description: Kiké Hernández’s game-tying RBI single caromed off the second-base bag and into shallow center field, sparking a three-run, seventh-inning rally that carried the AL wild-card leading Boston Red Sox to an 8-6 victory over the Baltimore Orioles Sunday and a sweep of their three-game series.

title: Kershaw 1st win since June, streaking Dodgers top shaky Reds
description: Clayton Kershaw pitched five sharp innings for his first win since June 27, Gavin Lux and Corey Seager each hit two-run homers and the streaking Los Angeles Dodgers beat the sliding Cincinnati Reds 8-5 Sunday.

title: Berríos tops old team, Blue Jays increase lead, beat Twins
description: José Berríos pitched into the seventh inning to beat his former team, Bo Bichette homered in a five-run first inning and the Toronto Blue Jays increased their lead in the playoff race by beating the Minnesota Twins 5-3 Sunday.

title: Soto's 454-foot homer helps Nationals beat Rockies 3-0
description: Juan Soto homered to back Paolo Espino, and the Washington Nationals beat Colorado 3-0 Sunday to end the Rockies' rare five-game road winning streak.

title: Gerrit Cole booed off the mound as the Yankees’ hopes for the playoffs dwindle
description: The Yankees had their ace Gerrit Cole on the mound against a mediocre at best Indians team as they looked to close the gap in the wild card race.

title: Padres' Manny Machado, Fernando Tatis Jr. get into heated incident in dugout
description: San Diego Padres stars Manny Machado and Fernando Tatis Jr. were seen getting into a spat in the dugout during the team’s loss to the St. Louis Cardinals on Saturday night.

title: Kaprielian, A's beat Angels 3-1 to keep pace for wild card
description: James Kaprielian pitched two-hit ball over six innings, Matt Olson hit his 36th home run and the Oakland Athletics beat the Los Angeles Angels 3-1 Saturday night.

title: Curt Casali's 2-run single holds up, Giants beat Braves 2-0
description: Alex Wood just wanted to find a nice rhythm again in his return from a bout with coronavirus, to continue working toward feeling at full strength come playoff time.

title: Segura, Nola lead surging Phils past Mets, tighten NL East
description: Jean Segura had his first multi-homer game in almost five years, Aaron Nola snapped a nine-start winless streak and the surging Philadelphia Phillies tightened the NL East race, beating the New York Mets 5-3 Saturday night.

title: Peters, Rangers stop Lynn, AL Central-leading White Sox 2-1
description: DJ Peters’ pinch-hit single drove home the go-ahead run in the sixth inning, helping the Texas Rangers beat former teammate Lance Lynn and the AL Central-leading Chicago White Sox 2-1 on Saturday night.

title: Shohei Ohtani HBP gets White Sox manager La Russa, pitcher Wright suspended
description: Los Angeles Angels star Shohei Ohtani was hit by a pitch as he batted during a game Thursday night. Now two members of the Chicago White Sox are paying the price.

title: Candelario and Garneau homer, Tigers beat Rays 4-3
description: Jeimer Candelario and Dustin Garneau homered to lead the Detroit Tigers over the AL East-leading Tampa Bay Rays 4-3 on Saturday.

title: Semien's 40th homer lifts Blue Jays back into playoff spot
description: Marcus Semien became the fifth second baseman to hit 40 home runs in a season, and the Toronto Blue Jays moved back into a playoff position by beating the Minnesota Twins 6-2 Saturday.

title: MLB ERA leader Scherzer dominates again, Dodgers beat Reds
description: Max Scherzer pitched seven shutout innings in another dominant performance for the Los Angeles Dodgers, who kept up their push in the NL West with a 5-1 victory over the Cincinnati Reds on Saturday.

title: Bogaerts, AL wild card-leading Bosox top O's, 4th win in row
description: Xander Bogaerts homered and drove in four runs, carrying the AL wild card-leading Boston Red Sox past the Baltimore Orioles 9-3 Saturday for their fourth straight win.

title: Sánchez error leads to 7-run inning, Indians slow Yanks 11-3
description: Gary Sánchez failed to catch a foul popup that led to a seven-run fifth inning capped by Andrés Giménez's three-run homer, and the Cleveland Indians routed the Yankees 11-3 on Saturday to slow New York's playoff run.

title: A's keep pace in wild-card race with 5-4 win over Angels
description: The Oakland Athletics committed three errors in the first two innings, stranded 10 runners through the first six and didn’t have an extra-base hit all night at the Big A.

title: Pinch-hitter pitcher Gausman sac fly in 11th, SF tops Braves
description: Kevin Gausman heard the boos when he stepped into the batter’s box, realizing right away the fans had no idea the Giants were down to their last options with no position players left.

title: White Sox blank Rangers 8-0 as magic number drops to 5
description: Luis Robert hit a three-run double, Dylan Cease struck out 10 in five innings and the Chicago White Sox moved closer to their first division title in 13 years by trouncing the Texas Rangers 8-0 on Friday night.

title: Carlson homers twice, Mikolas gets first win in two years
description: Dylan Carlson homered twice, including a grand slam, to help Miles Mikolas win for the first time in two years as the St. Louis Cardinals beat the San Diego Padres 8-2 on Friday night.

title: Brewers rally to top Cubs 8-5, move closer to division title
description: Kolten Wong hit a tiebreaking single with two outs in the eighth inning and the Milwaukee Brewers moved closer to a playoff berth by beating the Chicago Cubs 8-5 on Friday night.

title: Diamondbacks lose 100th of season, fall 4-3 to Astros
description: Chas McCormick was hit by a pitch with the bases loaded to drive in the winning run in the 10th inning as the Houston Astros sent the Arizona Diamondbacks to their 100th loss with a 4-3 win on Friday night.

title: Wheeler, Phillies hold off Mets 4-3 to boost playoff hopes
description: Zack Wheeler limited the damage in a short but effective outing against his old team, Brad Miller hit a tiebreaking homer and the Philadelphia Phillies held off the New York Mets 4-3 Friday night in a showdown between teams clinging to postseason aspirations.

title: Guerrero hits 46th HR, but Twins hit 3 in row, top Blue Jays
description: Vladimir Guerrero Jr. connected for his major league-leading 46th homer, but Jorge Polanco, Josh Donaldson, and Miguel Sanó hit consecutive homers as the Minnesota Twins beat the Toronto Blue Jays 7-3 Friday night.

title: Phillips homers in 10th as Rays rally to beat Tigers 7-4
description: Brett Phillips hit a three-run homer in the 10th inning and the AL East-leading Tampa Bay Rays came back from a three-run deficit in the ninth to beat the Detroit Tigers 7-4 on Friday night.

title: Two-way star Shohei Ohtani to pitch Sunday for Angels
description: Shohei Ohtani will pitch for the Los Angeles Angels on Sunday after his sore arm apparently felt much better in a bullpen session.

title: Sale returns, Red Sox send Orioles to loss No. 100, 7-1
description: Chris Sale returned from COVID-19 to pitch five innings of two-hit ball, and Bobby Dalbec homered to help the Boston Red Sox beat Baltimore 7-1 on Friday night and send the Orioles to their 100th loss of the season.

title: Castillo outdoes Buehler, Reds end Dodgers' win streak at 6
description: Luis Castillo struck out 10 while outpitching Walker Buehler, Kyle Farmer doubled twice against his former team and the Cincinnati Reds snapped the Los Angeles Dodgers’ six-game winning streak with a 3-1 victory Friday night.

title: Kluber beats Indians, Gallo homers twice as Yanks win 8-0
description: Corey Kluber won for the first time in nearly four months, pitching six shutout innings in his first outing against the team that helped him blossom into a star, and the New York Yankees routed Cleveland 8-0 Friday night in the start of the Indians’ final series in the Bronx.

title: Phillies' Didi Gregorius links COVID vaccine side effect to down year
description: Philadelphia Phillies shortstop Didi Gregorius is in the midst of one of the worst seasons of his career, and he’s pointing to at least one difference between this year and last.

title: Correa HR triggers 7-run 4th, Astros roll past Rangers 12-1
description: Carlos Correa and the Houston Astros are closing in on another AL West title after dominating their last-place Texas rival again.

title: Rays beat Tigers 5-2, extend AL East lead to 8 1/2 games
description: Yandy Díaz hit a leadoff home run and Mike Zunino later connected, reliever Dietrich Enns pitched four solid innings and the AL East-leading Tampa Bay Rays beat the Detroit Tigers 5-2 on Thursday night.

title: Harper homers, rallies Phils from 7 down in 17-8 win vs Cubs
description: Bryce Harper keeps earning those “MVP!” chants in Philly.

title: Yanks toss it away in 9th, fall to Hays, Orioles 3-2 in 10th
description: Yankees reliever Clay Holmes threw a wild pitch with two outs in the ninth inning that let the tying run score, then Austin Hays chopped an RBI single in the 10th that lifted the Baltimore Orioles to a 3-2 win Thursday night, dropping New York back in the AL wild-card race.

title: Royals' Perez ties Bench's HR mark with 45th in loss to A's
description: Salvador Perez tied Johnny Bench’s record for homers in a season by a catcher with his 45th, but Chad Pinder’s two-run single spurred a third-inning rally and the Oakland Athletics held off the Kansas City Royals 7-2 Thursday.

title: Tatis hits 39th HR, Padres beat Giants 7-4 to gain on Cards
description: Fernando Tatis Jr. hit his NL-leading 39th home run and the San Diego Padres beat the San Francisco Giants 7-4 on Thursday to earn a series split.

title: Cobb’s 5 scoreless IP in return lead Angels over White Sox
description: Alex Cobb pitched five scoreless innings, Luis Rengifo and Jose Rojas hit home runs, and the Los Angeles Angels coasted to a 9-3 win over the Chicago White Sox on Thursday.

title: Mahle, Reds avoid sweep, edge Pirates 1-0
description: Cincinnati Reds reliever Mychal Givens has been around long enough to understand the rhythms of a season.

title: Braves, Rockies face schedule headache after postponement
description: The Atlanta Braves have new incentive to take care of business in the National League East as quickly as possible.

title: 2 Nationals members who refused COVID vaccine threaten legal action after termination
description: An exclusive press release was received by OutKick containing official responses on behalf of Larry Pardo and Brad Holman, former members of the Washington Nationals staff.

title: Orioles' grounds crew appear to get ejected, MLB umpire says it didn't happen
description: Baseball fans tuning into Wednesday’s Yankees-Orioles game were stunned to see MLB umpire Tim Timmons seem to eject the grounds crew attempting to cover the field from the imminent storm.

title: Orioles' Cedric Mullins stuns with incredible catch, robbing Yankees' Gary Sanchez
description: Baltimore Orioles center fielder Cedric Mullins threw his name into the ring for “Catch of the Year” on Wednesday night in a close game against the New York Yankees.

title: Cardinals soar into playoff position behind ageless arms
description: On the morning of the trade deadline in late July, the St. Louis Cardinals were a .500 team sitting 7 1/2 games outside a playoff spot.

title: Tatis, Padres end 5-game skid, cut Giants' 9-game win streak
description: It took more than four hours and San Diego finally returned to the win column — and the Padres desperately needed this one to stay right in the playoff race.

title: Urías wins MLB-leading 18th, Dodgers beat D-backs 5-3
description: On a night when the Los Angeles Dodgers honored a past Mexican-born pitching legend, an up-and-coming one was busy adding his name to history.

title: Gardner's 2-run single in 9th lifts Yankees over Orioles 4-3
description: Brett Gardner blooped a two-run single in the ninth inning that was set up by a double steal, and the New York Yankees beat the Baltimore Orioles 4-3 Wednesday night for their third straight win.

title: Tapia's tiebreaking single in 10th sends Rockies over Braves
description: Rockies reliever Tyler Kinley knew the wet conditions were going to make it tough to grip the ball. That didn't stop him and the Colorado bullpen from shutting down the Atlanta Braves.

title: A's hold off Royals 12-10 to keep pace in AL wild-card race
description: Matt Olson hit a two-run homer, Josh Harrison drove in three runs and Elvis Andrus had four hits as the Oakland Athletics held on through a nervy ninth inning to beat the Kansas City Royals 12-10 on Wednesday night.

title: Marsh homers off Kopech in 8th, Angels top White Sox 3-2
description: Angels manager Joe Maddon has learned at least one thing about Brandon Marsh in the outfielder's first season in the majors.

title: Indians pound out 14 hits, Quantrill cruises past Twins 12-3
description: Cal Quantrill was cruising until a five-run seventh inning by his Cleveland teammates extended his stay in the dugout while waiting to return to the mound in Minnesota for the bottom of the frame.

title: Difo scores winning run in ninth, Pirates keep Reds slumping
description: Wilmer Difo scored on a groundout from Colin Moran with one out in the ninth inning, and the Pittsburgh Pirates handed the Cincinnati Reds a seventh loss in nine games with a 5-4 win Wednesday night.

title: Bichette HRs, drives in 5; Ray fans 13 as Jays beat Rays 6-3
description: Bo Bichette homered and matched his career-high with five RBIs, Robbie Ray fanned 13 over seven innings to claim the major league strikeout lead and the Toronto Blue Jays beat the Tampa Bay Rays 6-3 Wednesday.

title: Schwarber, Vazquez power Red Sox past Mariners 9-4 in 10
description: Kyle Schwarber and Christian Vazquez drove in two runs apiece in the 10th inning, and the Boston Red Sox beat the Seattle Mariners 9-4 on Wednesday to keep pace in the AL wild-card race.

title: Angels OFs Mike Trout, Jo Adell likely done for the year
description: Mike Trout is likely done for the year. Same for Jo Adell, another talented outfielder for the Los Angeles Angels.

title: Garneau, Tigers complete 2-game sweep of contending Brewers
description: Dustin Garneau homered and drove in two runs, rookie Matt Manning combined with the bullpen on a three-hitter and the Detroit Tigers beat the Milwaukee Brewers 4-1 on Wednesday to complete a two-game sweep.

title: Angels' Luis Rengifo subject of arrest warrant in Venezuela for falsifying documents: report
description: An arrest warrant has been issued in Venezuela for Los Angeles Angels infielder Luis Rengifo for allegedly falsifying documents, according to multiple reports.

title: Cards hold off Mets 7-6 in 11 to move into playoff position
description: After more than 4 1/2 hours of back-and-forth baseball, the St. Louis Cardinals finally control their playoff fate again.

title: Dodgers clinch postseason berth in 8-4 win over D-backs
description: The Dodgers are chasing the San Francisco Giants in the NL West. They caught their rival in one big way by becoming the second team in the majors to clinch a postseason berth.

title: Choi and Lowe HR, Rays beat Jays 2-0 to reach 90-win mark
description: Drew Rasmussen combined with four relievers on a three-hitter. Brandon Lowe and Ji-Man Choi homered and the Tampa Bay Rays became the first AL team to reach 90 wins by beating the Toronto Blue Jays 2-0 Tuesday night.

title: Judge starts 5-HR barrage to back Cole, Yanks beat O's 7-2
description: Aaron Judge started a five-homer barrage that backed Gerrit Cole, and the New York Yankees beat the Baltimore Orioles 7-2 Tuesday night to win consecutive games for the first time since Sept. 1 and 3.

title: Mike Piazza's video pitch for Larry Elder fails to sway California voters to oust Newsom in recall election
description: Baseball Hall of Famer Mike Piazza went to bat for California Republican Larry Elder on Tuesday, urging voters to oust first-term Democratic Gov. Gavin Newsom in the state's recall election – but it didn't work.

title: Slugger Ryan Braun retires after 14-year career with Brewers
description: Ryan Braun, the Milwaukee Brewers' home run leader whose production was slowed by injuries during the second half of his 14-year career, announced his retirement on Tuesday.

title: Seattle Mariners to host 2023 MLB All-Star Game
description: The Seattle Mariners will host baseball's 2023 All-Star Game at T-Mobile Park.

title: Giants clinch playoff spot, thump Padres 9-1 for 8th in row
description: It’s been five years since Brandon Belt got to toast a playoff berth, so the Giants first baseman was admittedly out of practice when the champagne started to flow in San Francisco’s clubhouse.

title: Kershaw strikes out 5 in return, Dodgers beat D-backs 5-1
description: With three weeks to go in the regular season and the Los Angeles Dodgers locked in a tight pennant race, Clayton Kershaw is back just in time.

title: Alcantara takes no-hitter into 7th, Marlins blank Nats 3-0
description: Sandy Alcantara allowed one hit over eight sparkling innings and the Miami Marlins beat the Washington Nationals 3-0 on Monday night.

title: Guerrero hits MLB-leading 45th HR, Blue Jays rout Rays 8-1
description: Vladimir Guerrero Jr. hit his major league-leading 45th home run, Alek Manoah set a career high by pitching eight shutout innings, and the Toronto Blue Jays beat the Tampa Bay Rays 8-1 on Monday night.

title: MLB umpire hit in face with baseball on errant throw during Cardinals-Mets game
description: An MLB umpire was hit in the face by an errant throw during a game Monday night between the New York Mets and the St. Louis Cardinals.

title: Judge, Sánchez rally Yanks from 5-run deficit over Twins 6-5
description: Aaron Judge hit a tying three-run homer off Alex Colomé with two outs in the eighth inning, Gary Sánchez lined a winning single in the 10th, and the New York Yankees overcame a five-run deficit to beat the Minnesota Twins 6-5 Monday.

title: Yankees, Mets involved in brief skirmish; Francisco Lindor hits go-ahead home run
description: The New York Yankees and New York Mets were involved in a brief skirmish at Citi Field on Sunday night.

title: Max Scherzer is epitome of efficiency in joining 3,000K club
description: As the standing ovation for his 3,000th career strikeout grew louder, Max Scherzer paused on the mound. He doffed his cap, tossed the souvenir ball toward the dugout, and immediately got back to work.

title: Gilbert sharp as Diamondbacks hurt Mariners again in 5-4 win
description: Tyler Gilbert gave up two hits in another sharp outing, Ketel Marte homered and the Arizona Diamondbacks beat the Seattle Mariners 5-4 on Sunday.

title: Dodgers' Scherzer gets 3,000th K, near perfecto vs Padres
description: Max Scherzer had been anticipating his 3,000th career strikeout. He had his family on hand, and Los Angeles Dodgers fans knew it was coming.

title: Rangers hold off A's 4-3 to win series, dent Oakland's hopes
description: Isiah Kiner-Falefa had three hits and two RBIs, Taylor Hearn won his fourth straight start and the Texas Rangers put another dent in Oakland’s playoff hopes, beating the Athletics 4-3 on Sunday.

title: Flores homers, Giants beat Cubs 6-5 for 7th straight win
description: Wilmer Flores flew halfway across the country knowing he would play in just one game before heading back home.

title: McCullers solid again, Tucker homers, Astros beat Angels 3-1
description: Lance McCullers Jr. threw six strong innings, Kyle Tucker homered and the Houston Astros beat the Los Angeles Angels 3-1 on Sunday.

title: Leury Garcia HR in 9th lifts White Sox over Red Sox 2-1
description: Leury Garcia hit a game-ending home run with two outs in the ninth inning to lift the Chicago White Sox over the Boston Red Sox 2-1 Sunday.

title: Hampson 2 homers, Rockies take 3 of 4 from Phillies
description: Garrett Hampson homered twice and knocked in all five runs as the Colorado Rockies dealt another blow to the Philadelphia Phillies' playoff hopes with a 5-4 victory Sunday.

title: Albies, Freeman go deep in 7th, Braves win series over Miami
description: Ozzie Albies and Freddie Freeman each hit a solo homer off Anthony Bass in the seventh inning, Eddie Rosario went deep off Edward Cabrera in the fourth, and the Atlanta Braves beat the Miami Marlins 5-3 on Sunday.

title: Nolan Arenado homers again, Cardinals beat Reds 2-0
description: J.A. Happ can finally get a good night of sleep.

title: Lauer takes no-no into 6th; Brewers hit 5 HRs in 11-1 rout
description: Eric Lauer no-hit Cleveland into the sixth inning a day after Milwaukee threw a history-making no-no, his teammates belted five homers and the Brewers beat the Indians 11-1 on Sunday.

title: Blue Jays hit five homers, pound Orioles 22-7
description: Lourdes Gurriel Jr. and Teoscar Hernández each hit a grand slam, Vladimir Guerrero Jr. slugged his 44th homer, and the Toronto Blue Jays overpowered the Baltimore Orioles 22-7 Sunday, finishing two runs shy of the franchise record.

title: Candelario 2 homers, Tigers walk off Rays with walk in 11th
description: Robbie Grossman drew a bases-loaded walk in the 11th inning, Jeimer Candelario homered twice, and the Detroit Tigers pulled out an 8-7 victory over the Tampa Bay Rays on Sunday.

title: Varsho homers, has 4 RBIs to help Diamondbacks beat Mariners
description: Daulton Varsho homered and drove in four runs and the Arizona Diamondbacks beat Seattle 7-3 on Saturday night to snap a six-game losing streak and deal a blow to the Mariners' wild-card hopes.

title: Betts homers on 4-RBI night, Dodgers beat Padres 5-4
description: Mookie Betts hit a tiebreaking, three-run homer with two outs in the fifth inning and the Los Angeles Dodgers held off the San Diego Padres 5-4 on Saturday ni

title: Judge HRs twice, rallies Yanks past Mets on 9/11 anniversary
description: A raucous New York crowd of 43,144 lurched and howled — frequently out of their seats — through a back-and-forth Subway Series game that followed an affecting Sept. 11 observance.

title: Shaw singles in 10th, Red Sox beat White Sox 9-8
description: Travis Shaw hit a tiebreaking single in the 10th inning after belting a three-run homer in the third and the Boston Red Sox beat the Chicago White Sox 9-8 on Saturday night.

title: Brewers' Burnes, Hader combine for MLB record 9th no-hitter
description: Milwaukee ace Corbin Burnes combined with reliever Josh Hader to pitch baseball’s record ninth no-hitter this season, breaking a mark set when pitchers began throwing overhand in 1884 as the Brewers beat the Cleveland Indians 3-0 on Saturday night.

title: Joey Wendle, Dietrich Enns lead Rays to 7-2 win over Tigers
description: Joey Wendle tripled and homered, 30-year-old Dietrich Enns won for the first time in the major leagues and the Tampa Bay Rays beat the Detroit Tigers 7-2 on Saturday.

title: La Stella, Belt lead Giants past Cubs 15-4 for 6th straight
description: Tommy La Stella and Brandon Belt each hit three-run homers, and the San Francisco Giants pounded the Chicago Cubs 15-4 on Saturday for their sixth straight win.

title: Rangers score five in 8th, come back to nip A's 8-6
description: Jonah Heim hit a two-run home run with two outs in the eighth to cap a five-run rally, lifting the Texas Rangers past the Oakland Athletics, 8-6, on Saturday.

title: Mets, Yankees and more pay tribute on 9/11 20th anniversary
description: Jacob deGrom stood next to Gerrit Cole along the first-base line, and Brandon Nimmo wedged between Aaron Judge and Giancarlo Stanton on the other side.

title: Former Yankees player Roger Clemens on how he was 'supposed to pitch' the night of 9/11
description: Former Yankees pitcher Roger Clemens spoke with Jon Scott on his experience following the September 11 terrorist attacks 20 years ago.

title: World Series champ Mike Montgomery throws rosin bag at KBO umpire in meltdown
description: Former MLB pitcher Mike Montgomery was involved in a heated moment with an umpire while playing for his Korean Baseball Organization team on Friday night.

title: Urías earns MLB-leading 17th win, Dodgers beat Padres 3-0
description: Pitching and just enough hitting got the Dodgers back to winning.

title: Olson's 4 RBIs lead A's past Rangers for 3rd straight win
description: The Oakland Athletics understand the ups and downs of a season, having started 2021 with six straight losses before soon winning 13 in a row.

title: Mariners inch closer in wild-card chase, top D'backs 5-4
description: Tom Murphy hit a two-run home run in the second inning and added a solo shot in the sixth, and the Seattle Mariners beat the Arizona Diamondbacks 5-4 on Friday night for their eighth win in 11 games.

title: Red Sox lefty Sale has COVID-19, scratched from Sunday start
description: Boston ace Chris Sale has tested positive for COVID-19 again, sidelining the left-hander while the Red Sox fight for positioning in the crowded AL playoff picture.

title: Megill's 10 Ks lead Mets over reeling, bumbling Yanks 10-3
description: The reeling Yankees made a Subway Series of mental and physical mistakes in their weekend opener at the Mets.

title: Ohtani hits 44th HR, but Astros tag him in win over Angels
description: Shohei Ohtani hit his major league-leading 44th home run, but got tagged early by José Altuve, Alex Bregman and the Houston Astros in a 10-5 win over the Los Angeles Angels on Friday night.

title: José Abreu hits 3-run homer as White Sox top Red Sox 4-3
description: When Carlos Rodón needed more, he found it.

title: Orioles hit two homers off Ray, beat Blue Jays 6-3
description: Cedric Mullins and Ryan McKenna homered off Robbie Ray and the Baltimore Orioles beat the Blue Jays 6-3 on Friday night to end Toronto's season-high winning streak at eight.

title: Cabrera 9 hits in row, Schoop, Tigers win; Rays' Franco hurt
description: Miguel Cabrera got his ninth straight hit before the string ended, Jonathan Schoop launched a grand slam and the Detroit Tigers beat the Tampa Bay Rays 10-4 Friday night.

title: Dodgers pitcher Trevor Bauer's leave extended through the 2021 season
description: Trevor Bauer’s administrative leave from the Los Angeles Dodgers was extended through the end of the season under an agreement reached Friday between MLB and the players' union.

title: Tom Rinaldi on how sports united country following 9/11
description: Fox Sports reporter Tom Rinaldi previews the Yankees-Mets matchup and tells the story of Welles Crowther, the Boston College lacrosse player who heroically ran into the World Trade Center after the attacks.

title: Mike Piazza's post-9/11 home run remains incredibly memorable
description: Ten days after the terrorist attacks of 9/11, the New York Mets had returned home in what would be the first professional sporting event to take place in the city since that tragic day. Nearly 20 years later, the events of that night are still remembered for being a pivotal moment in the nation’s healing.

title: Joc Pederson gets key hit as Braves beat Nationals in 10
description: Joc Pederson hit a tiebreaking single with two out in the 10th inning, lifting the Atlanta Braves to a 7-6 victory over the Washington Nationals on Thursday night.

title: Jays beat Yanks for 8th straight, 1/2 game back in wild card
description: The Blue Jays gave the Yankees a Bronx battering this week they haven't experienced since they were still the Highlanders.

title: McMahon, Hilliard homer in 9th, rally Rockies over Phillies
description: Pinch-hitter Ryan McMahon and Sam Hilliard hit back-to-back home runs with two outs in the ninth inning, rallying the Colorado Rockies over the Philadelphia Phillies 4-3 on Thursday night.

title: Chisholm's homer in 8th lifts Marlins over Mets 3-2
description: Jazz Chisholm Jr. hit a tiebreaking solo homer in the eighth inning and the Miami Marlins beat the New York Mets 3-2 Thursday night.

title: Indians snap 25-inning scoreless streak, beat Twins 4-1
description: Franmil Reyes, Oscar Mercado and José Ramirez homered, and the Cleveland Indians scored for the first time in three games, beating the Minnesota Twins 4-1 on Thursday night.

title: Manaea fans 9, A’s beat White Sox 3-1
description: Sean Manaea struck out nine in seven dominant innings, and the Oakland Athletics beat the Chicago White Sox 3-1 on Thursday.

title: O'Neill homers, Cards win 2-1 to salvage split with Dodgers
description: Tyler O’Neill hit a tiebreaking homer, Cardinals relievers combined for five scoreless innings, and St. Louis salvaged a split of its four-game series against the Los Angeles Dodgers with a 2-1 win on Thursday.

title: Yankees' Taillon out with ankle tear, Britton has TJ surgery
description: Yankees starter Jameson Taillon was added to the 10-day injured list Thursday with a partial tear of a tendon in his right ankle, and manager Aaron Boone also said reliever Zack Britton has had season-ending Tommy John surgery.

title: Red Sox's Hunter Refroe says team was told to stop COVID testing; MLB, team deny allegation
description: Boston Red Sox outfielder Hunter Renfroe made a wild claim in a radio interview Wednesday.

title: Delmon Young, former top MLB draft pick, arrested for allegedly striking ex-girlfriend: report
description: Delmon Young, a former top MLB draft pick and 2012 American League Championship Series MVP, was arrested for domestic violence and other charges in Florida Monday.

title: After 9/11, George W. Bush was called upon to throw the perfect pitch at the 2001 World Series
description: It was a late October night at a packed Yankee Stadium as President George W. Bush prepared to throw the first pitch before Game 3 of the World Series just weeks after the terrorist attacks of 9/11.

title: Chapman homers, Montas shuts down White Sox as A's end skid
description: The consistency of Frankie Montas every fifth day has meant so much to the Oakland Athletics down the stretch.

title: Darvish earns 1st win in 11 starts, Padres beat Angels 8-5
description: The San Diego Padres are beginning to get some strong starting pitching just at the right time.

title: Eduardo Escobar's homer lifts Brewers past Phillies 4-3
description: Eduardo Escobar hit a tiebreaking solo homer in the sixth inning, and the Milwaukee Brewers topped the Philadelphia Phillies 4-3 on Wednesday night.

title: Soto's go-ahead homer sends Nationals past Braves, 4-2
description: Juan Soto and Freddie Freeman showed goodwill after each star was hit by a pitch in the first two games of the Washington-Atlanta series.

title: Heyward’s walk-off HR in 10th gives Cubs 4-1 win over Reds
description: Jason Heyward hit a three-run homer in the bottom of the 10th inning to give the Chicago Cubs a 4-1 win over the Cincinnati Reds on Wednesday night for their eighth victory in nine games.

title: Guerrero, streaking Jays drop sliding Yanks from top WC spot
description: Vladimir Guerrero Jr. hit his 41st home run and the streaking Toronto Blue Jays knocked the slumping Yankees out of the AL’s top wild-card spot, beating New York 6-3 Wednesday night.

title: Molina homers, Wainwright wins as Cards beat Dodgers 5-4
description: Adam Wainwright pitched into the ninth inning and Yadier Molina homered, helping the St. Louis Cardinals top the Los Angeles Dodgers 5-4 on Wednesday night.

title: Renfroe HRs in 8th, throws out runner in 9th for Red Sox
description: Hunter Renfroe hit a two-run homer in the eighth inning and threw out Joey Wendle trying for a triple from deep center field for the final out of the ninth as the Boston Red Sox beat the Tampa Bay Rays 2-1 Wednesday night.

title: De La Cruz lifts Marlins over Mets 2-1 in 10 innings
description: Bryan De La Cruz had three hits, including a game-winning single off the center-field fence in the bottom of the 10th inning that gave the Miami Marlins a 2-1 victory over the New York Mets on Wednesday night.

title: Marmolejos, Mariners score 4 in 9th, avoid sweep by Astros
description: In the wild-card chase with precious few games remaining, the Seattle Mariners don't have time to sulk after tough losses.

title: Derek Jeter's wife Hannah, kids make rare public appearance as they sweetly support his Hall of Fame induction
description: Sports Illustrated Swimsuit model Hannah Jeter, 31, and their two daughters, Story Grey, 1, and Bella Raine, 3, accompanied the partial owner of the Miami Marlins as he saw his name and famous No. 2 immortalized in baseball history.

title: Boone says Yanks ace Cole 'encouraged' about his condition
description: A day after New York Yankees ace Gerrit Cole exited his start because of tightness in his left hamstring, manager Aaron Boone said the star right-hander was feeling better about his situation.

title: Giants get 4 in 9th to beat Rockies; 1st team with 90 wins
description: LaMonte Wade Jr. and Evan Longoria each had two RBIs during a four-run rally in the ninth inning and the streaking San Francisco Giants beat the Colorado Rockies 7-4 on Wednesday.

title: Derek Jeter jabs baseball writer who didn't vote for him during Hall of Fame speech
description: Derek Jeter took a slight jab at the lone baseball writer who failed to vote for him to get into the Hall of Fame unanimously during his speech at the induction ceremony on Wednesday afternoon.

title: Managers, players share their favorite Derek Jeter memories: ‘He kept coming through’
description: Derek Jeter will be enshrined in the Baseball Hall of Fame in Cooperstown on Wednesday.

title: Yankees honor Derek Jeter ahead of Hall of Fame induction ceremony
description: Derek Jeter will finally be enshrined into the Baseball Hall of Fame on Wednesday after a 20-year career with the New York Yankees that saw him and the team win five World Series titles.

title: Snell loses gem in 7th, Padres fall 4-0 to Adell, Angels
description: Blake Snell made another bid at a gem.

title: White Sox beat A's 6-3; Oakland drops fourth straight game
description: Tony La Russa has seen his share of celebrations during all his decades in baseball. What the Chicago White Sox gave Jimmy Lambert for his first major league win ranked right up there.

title: Webb, Yastrzemski, Duggar power Giants past Rockies 12-3
description: Logan Webb pitched effectively for seven innings, Mike Yastrzemski homered and Steve Duggar had two triples among his three hits as the NL West-leading San Francisco Giants beat the Colorado Rockies 12-3 Tuesday night.

title: Correa hits RBI double in 10th, Astros rally past M's 5-4
description: Carlos Correa drove in the winning run in the 10th inning after Alex Bregman tied the game in the ninth, and the Houston Astros rallied past the Seattle Mariners 5-4 on Tuesday night.

title: Alonso homers twice, including 100th, as Mets top Marlins
description: Pete Alonso hit two home runs, including the 100th of his career, and the New York Mets beat the Miami Marlins 9-4 on Tuesday night to give Carlos Carrasco his first win with the team.

title: Lauer shines as Brewers roll to 10-0 blowout of Phillies
description: Eric Lauer is pitching better as the season gets later.

title: Albies, Duvall go deep in Braves' 8-5 win over Nationals
description: Ozzie Albies hit a tiebreaking, two-run homer off Ryne Harper in the seventh inning, Adam Duvall took Paolo Espino deep with an early three-run shot, and the Atlanta Braves beat the Washington Nationals 8-5 on Tuesday night.

title: Pujols homers in return to St. Louis, Dodgers down Cards 7-2
