description: Albert Pujols rewarded an adoring crowd by hitting a home run in his return to Busch Stadium, sending the Los Angeles Dodgers toward a 7-2 win over the St. Louis Cardinals on Tuesday night.

title: Miley goes 7, Castellanos and India homer as Reds stop Cubs
description: Wade Miley was terrific, and Kyle Farmer made a pair of clutch plays. Jonathan India and Nick Castellanos had a couple of big swings.

title: Cruz, 41, oldest to hit 30 HRs in year, Rays bop Bosox 12-7
description: Nelson Cruz homered twice and, at 41 years old, became the oldest player in major league history to hit 30 home runs in a season, powering the Tampa Bay Rays past the Boston Red Sox 12-7 Tuesday night.

title: Cole hurt, surging Blue Jays power past skidding Yanks 5-1
description: Marcus Semien homered again, Alejandro Kirk went deep twice and the surging Toronto Blue Jays beat the skidding Yankees 5-1 on Tuesday night after New York ace Gerrit Cole exited early with a hamstring injury.

title: Gant wins, Rooker homers as Twins blank Indians 3-0
description: One of the Twins' expectant fathers delivered.

title: Yankees ace Cole exits with tightness in his left hamstring
description: New York Yankees ace Gerrit Cole exited Tuesday night's game against the Toronto Blue Jays with two outs in the fourth inning because of tightness in his left hamstring.

title: Indians manager Terry Francona resting after toe surgery
description: Indians manager Terry Francona is resting comfortably after undergoing toe surgery, his second operation since stepping aside for the season in July.

title: Royals' Perez giving fans reason to watch September baseball
description: In retrospect, the Chicago White Sox probably should have walked Salvador Perez with first base open in the first inning of a scoreless game Sunday, even if it would have gone against just about every traditional baseball strategy.

title: Ex-MLB pitcher Kyle Farnsworth faces backlash over critical tweet of player
description: Former MLB pitcher Kyle Farnsworth criticized a player -- presumably Trey Mancini -- for sitting out of a game because of “general soreness.”

title: Finally, Jeter, Walker and Simmons to be inducted into HOF
description: Derek Jeter visited Cooperstown when he was a kid nearly four decades ago and says he doesn't remember much about the trip. He's returning this week and likely won't ever forget even one moment.

title: Meyers has homer, 4 RBIs as Astros rout Mariners 11-2
description: Astros rookie Jake Meyers homered and drove in four runs as Houston jumped on Yusei Kikuchi early and sailed to an 11-2 win over the Seattle Mariners on Monday night.

title: Estrada, Gausman lead Giants past Rockies, 10-5
description: The San Francisco Giants got to Denver late and woke up early. They had just played an intense series against a longtime rival, so a letdown in Colorado would have been excusable.

title: Scherzer strikes out 13, Dodgers beat Cardinals 5-1
description: Max Scherzer struck out 13 in his hometown and Chris Taylor hit a two-run homer, leading the Los Angeles Dodgers to a 5-1 victory over the St. Louis Cardinals on Monday.

title: Meadows, Rays rally from 6 runs down, beat Bosox 11-10 in 10
description: Down by six runs, facing Red Sox ace Chris Sale and playing at Fenway Park, the Tampa Bay Rays were just getting warmed up.

title: Harper, Phils hit 6 HRs, Wheeler shuts down Brewers 12-0
description: Bryce Harper hit an early home run, Brad Miller connected twice and Jean Segura added a grand slam, leading Zack Wheeler and the Philadelphia Phillies to a 12-0 romp over the Milwaukee Brewers on Monday.

title: Schwindel hits tiebreaking single as Cubs beat Reds 4-3
description: Frank Schwindel hit a tiebreaking RBI single in the eighth inning, and the Chicago Cubs topped the Cincinnati Reds 4-3 on Monday for their season-high seventh straight win.

title: Guerrero Jr, Semien power surging Jays past Yanks 8-0
description: Vladimir Guerrero Jr. hit his 40th homer, Marcus Semien went deep twice and the Toronto Blue Jays beat the New York Yankees 8-0 on Monday for their fifth straight win.

title: Kieboom, Nats rally again, score 2 in 9th to edge Mets 4-3
description: Carter Kieboom and Andrew Stevenson hit RBI singles in the ninth inning off Edwin Díaz and the Washington Nationals rallied once again, edging the New York Mets 4-3 Monday in the finale of a five-game series.

title: Braves sign RHP Morton to $20 million deal for 2022
description: The Atlanta Braves locked up another key player for next season, announcing a $20 million, one-year deal for pitcher Charlie Morton on Monday.

title: Mets owner Steve Cohen blasts Javy Baez critics after solid game
description: New York Mets owner Steve Choen called out critics of second baseman Javy Baez after he went 4-for-4 with a home run, two RBI and three runs scored in a 13-6 blowout win Sunday against the last-place Washington Nationals.

title: Duggar triples, Giants hold off Dodgers 6-4 for NL West lead
description: If the Dodgers and Giants just provided a glimpse of a possible playoff series, an October matchup between these rivals could be one for the ages.

title: Seager's double keys 11th inning rally, Mariners top D-backs
description: Kyle Seager hit a go-ahead, two-RBI double to spark an 11th-inning rally and lift the Seattle Mariners over the Arizona Diamondbacks 10-4 on Sunday to complete the three-game series sweep.

title: DJ Peters has 2 HRs, 4 hits to help Rangers beat Angels 7-3
description: DJ Peters homered twice, had a career-high four hits and drove in four runs, and Taylor Hearn pitched seven innings of seven-hit ball in the Texas Rangers' 7-3 victory over the Los Angeles Angels on Sunday.

title: Cronenworth homers in 9th, Padres win; Stanek, Astros tumble
description: Jake Cronenworth hit a solo home run with one out in the ninth inning and the San Diego Padres beat the Houston Astros 4-3 Sunday to take two of three from the AL West leaders.

title: Schwindel's grand slam lifts Cubs over Pirates 11-8
description: Frank Schwindel hit a go-ahead grand slam, Matt Duffy homered twice, including a grand slam, and the Chicago Cubs outslugged the Pittsburgh Pirates on Sunday for an 11-8 win.

title: Vogelbach slam in 9th caps comeback, Brewers shock Cards 6-5
description: Daniel Vogelbach delivered a pinch-hit grand slam off Alex Reyes to cap a five-run rally in the ninth inning that gave the Milwaukee Brewers a 6-5 victory over the St. Louis Cardinals on Sunday.

title: Indians homer in 19th straight; beat Sox 11-5
description: Franmil Reyes homered over the Green Monster to spark a three-run third inning — Cleveland’s franchise-record tying 19th straight game with a home run — and the Indians salvaged the finale of the series with an 11-5 victory over the COVID-impacted Boston Red Sox on Sunday.

title: Sánchez 2 HRs, 6 RBIs, but Yanks blow lead, fall to O's 8-7
description: Gary Sánchez hit a grand slam and a two-run homer, but the New York Yankees blew a late lead and lost again to Baltimore, falling to the last-place Orioles 8-7 Sunday.

title: Herrera hits RBI single in 10th, Phils avoid sweep in Miami
description: Odúbel Herrera hit an RBI single in the 10th inning and the Philadelphia Phillies averted a three-game sweep, beating the Miami Marlins 4-3 Sunday.

title: Singer, Perez lead Royals to 6-0 win over White Sox
description: Brady Singer tossed seven scoreless innings and Salvador Perez hit another home run as the Kansas City Royals beat the Chicago White Sox 6-0 on Sunday.

title: Báez 4 for 4, Pillar slam, Mets hit 4 HRs to beat Nats 13-6
description: Javier Báez went 4 for 4 with a home run, Kevin Pillar hit a grand slam that capped a game-sealing, six-run ninth inning, and the New York Mets withstood another rally from the Washington Nationals to earn a 13-6 victory Sunday.

title: Tigers quiet Reds' bats, take series with 4-1 win
description: Jeimer Candelario snapped a scoreless tie with a two-run triple, five Detroit pitchers combined to frustrate Cincinnati’s offense and the Tigers captured the three-game interleague series with a 4-1 win on Sunday.

title: Ray fans 10, Blue Jays finish 3-game sweep of struggling A's
description: Robbie Ray struck out 10 while pitching one-hit ball into the seventh inning, Marcus Semien hit his 35th home run and the Toronto Blue Jays beat the Oakland Athletics 8-0 Sunday to complete a three-game sweep.

title: Red Sox add RHP Pivetta, INF/OF Santana to COVID-19 IL
description: The Boston Red Sox scratched Nick Pivetta on Sunday and placed the right-hander on the COVID-19 injured list.

title: Dodgers beat Giants 6-1, move into tie for first in NL West
description: Trea Turner and Corey Seager homered, Julio Urías won his seventh straight decision, and the Los Angeles Dodgers moved into a tie for first place with San Francisco atop the NL West Division with a 6-1 victory over the Giants on Saturday night.

title: Machado, Myers, Tatis homer in Padres' 10-2 win vs. Astros
description: Manny Machado, Wil Myers and Fernando Tatis Jr. each hit an impressive two-run home run and Joe Musgrove had a solid outing against one of his former teams as the San Diego Padres beat the AL West-leading Houston Astros 10-2 Saturday night.

title: Blackmon, Cron power Rockies past NL East-leading Braves 7-6
description: Charlie Blackmon homered for the third straight game, Raimel Tapia had a go-ahead sacrifice fly and the Colorado Rockies hung on to beat the Atlanta Braves 7-6 Saturday night.

title: Ohtani hits MLB-high 43rd HR, Suarez CG as Angels beat Texas
description: Shohei Ohtani hit his major league-leading 43rd home run and Jose Suarez pitched a five-hitter, leading the Los Angeles Angels to a 4-1 win over the Texas Rangers on Saturday night.

title: Grandal, Chisox hold on 10-7; Royals' Perez reaches 40 HRs
description: Yasmani Grandal went 3 for 3 with a home run and four RBIs as the Chicago White Sox built a big lead and then held off Salvador Perez and the Kansas City Royals 10-7 Saturday night.

title: Nats stop Mets' 6-game win streak, end own skid with split
description: Lane Thomas and Alcides Escobar homered as the Washington Nationals ended a seven-game skid, beating the Mets 4-3 Saturday night to split a doubleheader and stop New York's six-game winning streak.

title: Houser pitches 3-hitter for 1st pro shutout, Brews top Cards
description: Adrian Houser pitched his first pro shutout, throwing a crisp three-hitter that led the Milwaukee Brewers over the St. Louis Cardinals 4-0 Saturday night.

title: Verdugo's RBI single in bottom of 9th lifts Bosox past Tribe
description: Alex Verdugo hit an RBI single with bases loaded and two out in the bottom of the ninth inning to give the Boston Red Sox a 4-3 win over the Cleveland Indians on Saturday.

title: Díaz, Rays tie team record with 6 HRs, romp past Twins 11-4
description: Yandy Díaz hit one of Tampa Bay's franchise record-tying six homers and drove in four runs, Wander Franco extended his on-base streak to 34 games and the AL East-leading Tampa Bay Rays beat the Minnesota Twins 11-4 on Saturday.

title: Hernández hits 100th HR, Jays go deep 4 times, beat A's 10-8
description: Teoscar Hernández hit his 100th career home run, José Berríos took a no-hitter into the fifth inning and the Blue Jays survived a late scare to beat the Oakland Athletics 10-8 Saturday, Toronto’s sixth win in seven games.

title: O's rally against Chapman, win after nearly no-hitting Yanks
description: Aroldis Chapman gave up Pedro Severino's tiebreaking sacrifice fly with the bases loaded in the ninth inning and the New York Yankees lost to Baltimore 4-3 Saturday after the last-place Orioles took a no-hitter into the seventh.

title: Mets blow 9-run lead, recover, beat Nats for 6th win in row
description: Francisco Lindor hit a two-run homer in the ninth inning and the New York Mets, after blowing a nine-run lead, extended their winning streak to six by beating the Washington Nationals 11-9 Saturday to open a split doubleheader on Saturday.

title: Minor league baseball game descends into chaos after home run
description: A minor league baseball game between the Seattle Mariners and Arizona Diamondbacks’ affiliates devolved into an all-out brawl between players on both teams.

title: Giants beat Dodgers 3-2 in 11th on error, take NL West lead
description: Buster Posey could exhale at last, his teammates knowing better than to dog pile on their 34-year-old catcher celebrating a wild, 4 1/2-hour game that put San Francisco atop the NL West.

title: Tucker, Correa homer for Astros in 6-3 win vs Padres
description: Carlos Correa sometimes refers to his swing as “sexy."

title: Ohtani strikes out 8 on 117 pitches, Angels beat Rangers 3-2
description: Shohei Ohtani's outing almost met an early end when he was struck by a comebacker in the first inning. Instead, he recovered and threw his most pitches since coming stateside in 2018.

title: Keuchel struggles again, White Sox lose to Royals 7-2
description: Dallas Keuchel had another rocky outing for the AL Central-leading White Sox, allowing six runs in three innings in Chicago’s 7-2 loss to the Kansas City Royals on Friday night.

title: Wainwright, Molina reach milestone; Cards rip Brewers 15-4
description: Adam Wainwright and Yadier Molina appreciated the magnitude of the career milestone they reached Friday night. They were more concerned about boosting the St. Louis Cardinals’ playoff hopes.

title: Rookie Kelenic leads Mariners over Diamondbacks 6-5 in 10
description: Rookie Jarred Kelenic hit a go-ahead single in the 10th inning after earlier launching a two-run homer to lead the Seattle Mariners past the Arizona Diamondbacks 6-5 on Friday night.

title: Senzatela pitches 7 strong innings, Rockies beat Braves 4-3
description: Antonio Senzatela overcame a leadoff home run by Ozzie Albies, pitching seven strong innings as the Colorado Rockies beat the Atlanta Braves 4-3 Friday night.

title: Semien hits walk-off HR, Jays rally three times to beat A's
description: Marcus Semien hit a game-ending three-run homer in the ninth inning after Lourdes Gurriel Jr. hit a tying grand slam in the eighth, and the Toronto Blue Jays rallied three times to stun the Oakland Athletics 11-10 Friday night.

title: Stanton's single in 11th lifts Yankees over Orioles 4-3
description: Giancarlo Stanton led off the 11th inning with an RBI single Friday night and the New York Yankees came back to edge the Baltimore Orioles 4-3.

title: Mets beat Nats in 10 innings for fifth straight win
description: Kevin Pillar drove in two with a 10th-inning double and the New York Mets recovered after blowing a late lead to beat the Washington Nationals 6-2 Friday night for their fifth straight win.

title: Schwarber, Red Sox beat Indians 8-5 for 3rd straight win
description: Kyle Schwarber hit a leadoff homer in the first inning, then delivered a tiebreaking, two-run double in the seventh that sent the Boston Red Sox over the Cleveland Indians 8-5 on Friday night.

title: Rojas 2 hits in 7-run burst, Miami ends Phils' 6-game streak
description: Miguel Rojas had two hits and three RBIs during a seven-run sixth inning and the Miami Marlins beat Philadelphia 10-3 Friday night, stopping the Phillies’ six-game winning streak.

title: Wacha goes 6 effective innings, Rays beat Twins 5-3
description: Michael Wacha struck out seven over six innings, Kevin Kiermaier had an RBI triple during a three-run second and the Tampa Bay Rays beat the Minnesota Twins 5-3 on Friday night.

title: Johnny Bench tests positive for virus, to miss Hall ceremony
description: Hall of Fame catcher Johnny Bench says he has tested positive for COVID-19 and will miss this year's induction ceremonies in Coop

title: Cubs manager Ross positive for virus, Chicago tops Pirates
description: After he was ejected, Chicago Cubs bench coach Andy Green contemplated how he might pass along his fine to manager David Ross or president of baseball operations Jed Hoyer.

title: Duvall's 2-run homer lifts Braves over Rockies 6-5
description: Adam Duvall hit a two-run homer in Atlanta’s three-run fifth inning, and the Braves overcame a grand slam by Charlie Blackmon to beat the Colorado Rockies 6-5 on Thursday night.

title: Indians' McKenzie shuts down Royals again in return from IL
description: Triston McKenzie limited Kansas City to a run and two hits over six innings and the Cleveland Indians beat the Royals 4-2 Thursday night.

title: Embattled Mets edge Marlins 4-3 for 5th straight victory
description: Pinch-hitter Dominic Smith broke a seventh-inning tie with an RBI single and the New York Mets beat the Miami Marlins 4-3 on Thursday night for their fifth straight victory.

title: Rodriguez, Richards combine on 5-hitter, Red Sox beat Rays
description: Eduardo Rodriguez pitched four-hit ball into the seventh inning, and the Boston Red Sox beat Tampa Bay 4-0 on Thursday night for a split of their four-game series with the AL East-leading Rays.

title: Spanish broadcaster pulls Yanks' Sterling from flooding car
description: Yankees broadcaster John Sterling was helped out of his flooding car by Spanish radio play-by-play man Rickie Ricardo on Wednesday night after Sterling got stuck trying to drive home after a game.

title: Giants beat Brewers 5-1, move into 1st-place tie
description: Thairo Estrada hit a three-run homer during San Francisco's four-run eighth inning, and the Giants beat the Brewers 5-1 on Thursday to avoid a four-game sweep.

title: Lowrie, Canha help A's start fast in 8-6 win over Tigers
description: Jed Lowrie hit a three-run homer in the first inning for the first of Oakland's eight two-out runs against Matt Manning in the Athletics' 8-6 victory over the Tigers on Thursday.

title: Phillies rally past Nationals 7-6, complete series sweep
description: Andrew McCutchen drove in four runs and the Philadelphia Phillies erased a six-run deficit against the Washington Nationals to earn a 7-6 victory Thursday and a three-game sweep.

title: Mets place acting GM on administrative leave after DWI arrest
description: The Mets placed acting general manager Zack Scott on administrative leave “until further notice,” the team announced Thursday, hours after Scott pleaded not guilty to driving while intoxicated.

title: Yankees' minor league affiliate sees ballpark submerged in storms
description: The ballpark for a New York Yankees’ minor league affiliate appeared to be completely flooded due to the chaotic storms that struck the Northeast on Wednesday night.

title: Dodgers rally past Braves for sweep, Scherzer leaves after 6
description: Max Scherzer felt his hamstring tighten up during warmups. He still went out and dominated the Atlanta Braves for six innings.

title: Brewers knock Giants from top spot in NL, win fourth in row
description: The San Francisco Giants are suddenly in second place, and the defending World Series champion Dodgers are atop the National League ahead of a weekend visit to the Bay Area.

title: Hedges' 11th-inning bloop lifts Indians over Royals 5-3
description: Austin Hedges popped an RBI single just out of reach of first baseman Carlos Santana for the tiebreaking run in the 11th inning and the Cleveland Indians beat the Kansas City Royals 5-3 Wednesday night.

title: Rookie Sheets hits 2 HRs, White Sox beat Pirates 6-3
description: Rookie Gavin Sheets hit two home runs, leading the Chicago White Sox to a 6-3 win over the Pittsburgh Pirates on Wednesday night.

title: Schwindel homers, Cubs shut down Twins hitters in 3-0 win
description: Frank Schwindel hit a three-run homer and a pair of Chicago Cubs pitchers combined on a two-hitter in a 3-0 victory over the Minnesota Twins on Wednesday night.

title: Cabrera hits career homer No. 502, Tigers beat Athletics 8-6
description: Miguel Cabrera hit a two-run homer, No. 502 of his career, and drove in the go-ahead run with a single in the seventh inning as the Detroit Tigers snapped a four-game skid with an 8-6 win over the Oakland Athletics on Wednesday night.

title: Grichuk breaks tie in 8th, Blue Jays beat Orioles 5-4
description: Randal Grichuk hit a tiebreaking sacrifice fly in the eighth inning and the Toronto Blue Jays beat the Baltimore Orioles 5-4 on Wednesday night.

title: Gerrit Cole fans 15, Yankees beat Angels 4-1 to end skid
description: While Gerrit Cole racked up a season-high 15 strikeouts on the diamond that was once his favorite field, Aaron Judge couldn't help pondering what the Yankees gained and the Angels lost when New York outmaneuvered Los Angeles for his services two years ago.

title: Duran has go-ahead single in the 9th, Red Sox beat Rays 3-2

description: It’s another thumbs-down for the Mets.

From which young Karin Kinsella falls moments later, requiring the services of Dr. Archibald “Moonlight” Graham — transforming from teenager to senior citizen — to save her life.

title: Rays rally past Red Sox 8-4, extend lead in AL East
description: Tampa Bay's Francisco Mejía singled with the bases loaded in the ninth, Boston's Hunter Renfroe made a costly error on the play, and it helped the Rays rally past the Red Sox 8-4 on Tuesday night.

title: Lowrie doubles in 10th, A's top Indians for 5th win in row
description: Jed Lowrie delivered an RBI double in the 10th inning and the Oakland Athletics extended their winning streak to five, beating the Cleveland Indians 4-3 on Tuesday night.

title: Astudillo sparks Twins in 4-3 win as Sox streak ends at 4

title: Astros snap Rockies' 4-game win streak with 5-0 victory
description: Jake Odorizzi and four relievers combined on a five-hit shutout, Taylor Jones had a two-run double and the Houston Astros beat Colorado 5-0 Tuesday night, snapping the Rockies’ four-game winning streak.

description: Buster Posey's baserunning skills played a big part in the Giants keeping their latest winning streak going.

description: Sportswriter Jason Whitlock told "Tucker Carlson Tonight" that, like in the original gold rush, those folks who are rushing for "racism gold" are driving off American patriots the same way miners slaughtered Native Americans in the Pacific coast states.

description: A day after the Colorado Rockies determined that a fan did not use a racial slur at Lewis Brinson during Sunday’s game, the Miami Marlins outfielder said that he heard differently.

description: Guy Fieri and Chevrolet have collaborated on an Apple Pie Hot Dog that will be served at Major League Baseball's Field of Dreams game. The snack is inspired by a 1975 Chevrolet commercial jingle.

description: Max Scherzer has accomplished many things during his 14-year major league career, but it wasn't until his first start for the Los Angeles Dodgers on Wednesday night that he got to enjoy this particular experience:

description: The United States started a pitcher who was Tampa Bay’s No. 12 prospect before he was dealt to Minnesota last week in the Nelson Cruz trade.

description: Shohei Ohtani hit his major league-leading 36th home run, one of the few highlights for the Los Angeles Angels in a 12-3 loss to the Colorado Rockies on Tuesday night.

description: Fernando Tatis Jr. has quite the flair for big home runs.

title: McCann, Lindor come through, Mets rally past Braves 4-3
description: James McCann hit a tying three-run homer off Charlie Morton in the four-run seventh inning, Francisco Lindor followed four batters later, singling in the go-ahead run off A.J. Minter, and the New York Mets beat the Atlanta Braves 4-3 on Tuesday night.

title: Semien, Bichette power Blue Jays to 9-3 win over Mariners
description: Marcus Semien homered and drove in five runs, Bo Bichette hit a three-run homer, and the Toronto Blue Jays beat the Seattle Mariners 9-3 on Tuesday night.

title: Velasquez tosses 2-hitter over 7, Phillies beat Marlins 4-3
description: Vince Velasquez tossed a two-hitter over seven innings, Rhys Hoskins hit a solo homer and the Philadelphia Phillies held on for a 4-3 victory over the Miami Marlins on Tuesday night.

title: Yankees overcome Ohtani's 2 HRs, slug past Angels 11-5
description: Shohei Ohtani was making Yankees manager Aaron Boone nervous — until the Angels' two-way star batted in the seventh inning Tuesday night.

title: Yankees' Brian Cashman on team's recent struggles: 'We suck right now'
description: General manager Brian Cashman isn’t happy with how the New York Yankees are playing, saying they are "as bad as you can be" right now, but he’s not blaming manager Aaron Boone for any of it.

title: Nats' Schwarber hits 12th homer in 10 games, 25th of season
description: Washington’s Kyle Schwarber led off the first inning against Tampa Bay on Tuesday night with his 12th home run in 10 games, tying Albert Belle in 1995 for the most over that span since at least 1901.

title: Angels, 2 former team employees accused of negligence in Tyler Skaggs family's lawsuit
description: Former pitcher Tyler Skaggs’ widow and family filed lawsuits on Tuesday in California and Texas against the Los Angeles Angels and two former employees for negligence in his drug-related death back in July of 2019.

title: Mariners' Hector Santiago suspended 10 games for violating grip-enhancing substances rules
description: Seattle Mariners pitcher Hector Santiago was the first player suspended in the wake of Major League Baseball’s crackdown on grip-enhancing substances.

title: Angels' Dylan Bundy suffers from heat exhaustion, vomits on mound at Yankee Stadium
description: Los Angeles Angels pitcher Dylan Bundy had a hard time with the heat Monday night.

title: Betts, Muncy early HRs propel Bauer, Dodgers over Giants 3-2
description: Early blasts by Mookie Betts and Max Muncy helped propel the Los Angeles Dodgers to a key win in the first of a two-game set against the San Francisco Giants.

title: Brewers score 10 in 8th, beat Cubs 14-4 for 6th straight win
description: The Milwaukee Brewers earned their sixth straight win by producing their biggest inning since manager Craig Counsell's playing days.

title: Castellanos hits slam as Reds rally past Phillies 12-4
description: Nick Castellanos hit a grand slam in the seventh inning and drove in a career-high seven runs, helping the Cincinnati Reds beat the Philadelphia Phillies 12-4 on Monday night.

title: Renfroe homers twice, Red Sox rally to beat Royals 6-5
description: Hunter Renfroe homered twice, the second a 434-foot solo shot over the Green Monster to break a sixth-inning tie and help the Red Sox rally from a four-run deficit to beat the Kansas City Royals 6-5 on Monday night.

title: Ohtani's 26th homer starts Angels past reeling Yankees 5-3
description: Shohei Ohtani pounded his hardest-hit home run of the season, José Suarez pitched 5 1/3 innings of one-run relief after Dylan Bundy threw up on the mound because of heat exhaustion and the Los Angeles Angels beat the troubled New York Yankees 5-3 Monday night.

title: Bat girl 60 years in making reaches Yankee Stadium
description: Gwen Goldman finally got to be a bat girl for the New York Yankees — 60 years after she was turned down because of her gender.

title: Mariners' Hector Santiago is first to be ejected for allegedly using grip-enhancing substances
description: Seattle Mariners pitcher Hector Santiago made dubious history Sunday when he became the first pitcher to be ejected from a game in wake of MLB’s crackdown on grip-enhancing substances.

title: Indians' Josh Naylor stretchered off field after scary incident vs. Twins
description: Cleveland Indians outfielder Josh Naylor was taken off the field on a stretcher Sunday after he collided with second baseman Ernie Clement during a game against the Minnesota Twins.

title: Kershaw's 13 Ks, McKinstry's slam lift Dodgers past Cubs 7-1
description: Clayton Kershaw wrapped up the eighth inning and left the mound to a standing ovation from the Dodger Stadium crowd after a performance measuring up to the best in his remarkable career.

title: Irvin fans 8, A's beat Giants 6-2 to avoid 3-game sweep
description: Cole Irvin struck out eight in eight innings to remain unbeaten in five June starts, and the Oakland Athletics beat the San Francisco Giants 6-2 on Sunday.

title: Kranick goes 5 perfect innings in MLB debut, Bucs top Cards
description: The only thing that got in Max Kranick's way was the weather.

title: Guerrero, Biggio lift Blue Jays to 5-2 win over Orioles
description: Vladimir Guerrero Jr. drove in two runs to raise his major league-leading RBI total to 66, and the Toronto Blue Jays beat the Baltimore Orioles 5-2 on Sunday.

title: Ohtani hits 25th homer, drives in 3 as Angels beat Rays 6-4
description: Shohei Ohtani hit his 25th homer and drove in three runs, and the Los Angeles Angels stopped a five-game losing streak by beating the Tampa Bay Rays 6-4 on Sunday.

title: Red Sox hammer Cole, rout Yanks 9-2 for another 3-game sweep
description: The Yankees were hoping a faster start might help them find a way to slow down the rival Red Sox.

title: Indians OF Naylor injured in scary collision, Twins win 8-2
description: Nelson Cruz hit a three-run homer shortly after Cleveland right fielder Josh Naylor was carted off the field following a frightening collision with a teammate, and the Minnesota Twins went beat the Indians 8-2 on Sunday.

title: LHP Santiago ejected, glove confiscated during Mariners' win
description: Seattle reliever Hector Santiago was ejected after he was checked by the umpires as part of baseball's new sticky substance protocols, and the Mariners beat the Chicago White Sox 3-2 on Sunday in the resumption of a suspended game.

title: Rays win 4th in a row, send Angels to 5th straight loss
description: Shane McClanahan pitched six effective innings, Brett Phillips drove in three runs and the Tampa Bay Rays beat the Los Angeles Angels 13-3 Saturday for their fourth straight win.

title: DeGrom's shutout streak ends at 31 innings, Mets top Phils
description: By the middle of his outing, Mets ace Jacob deGrom was struggling to find his mechanics that essentially made him a two-pitch pitcher.

title: Eovaldi strong, Red Sox run win streak to 5 over Yanks, 4-2
description: Playing against the New York Yankees seems to bring out the best in Nathan Eovaldi. His latest performance has the Boston Red Sox on the verge of a second straight sweep of their longtime rivals.

title: Dbacks rout Padres 10-1, end record 24-game road losing skid
description: It had been 62 days and 24 road games since the Arizona Diamondbacks shook hands on the field after a victory.

title: Orioles rally, beat Blue Jays 6-5 to end 20-game road skid
description: Austin Hays drove in two runs to cap an eighth-inning rally, and the Baltimore Orioles beat the Toronto Blue Jays 6-5 in 10 innings Friday night to stop a 20-game road losing streak.

title: Red Sox hold on for 4th straight win over Yankees, 5-3
description: The Yankees bats have been some of hottest in the majors lately. They ran into a Red Sox bullpen that find ways to quiet them down.

title: Crowe gets 1st win, Pirates send Cards to 18th loss in 24
description: Wil Crowe gave up four runs over five innings for his first major league win, and the Pittsburgh Pirates beat the St. Louis Cardinals 5-4 on Friday night for their fifth victory in seven games following a 10-game losing streak.

title: Pollock, Muncy help Dodgers beat Cubs to snap 4-game skid
description: After suffering a three-game sweep at San Diego and then being no hit by the Chicago Cubs the previous night, it would have been understandable if AJ Pollock and the Los Angeles Dodgers were reeling a bit in what has been an abysmal week so far.

title: Tatis hits 3 HRs, Pads hand D-Backs 24th straight road loss
description: Hours after saying he would skip the All-Star Home Derby next month, Fernando Tatis Jr. put on his own personal power show.

title: Cubs toss combined no-hitter, tie major-league record
description: Zach Davies, Ryan Tepera, Andrew Chafin and Craig Kimbrel were a part of the historic moment

title: Correa leads Astros to 11th straight win, 12-3 over Tigers
description: Carlos Correa had three hits, walked twice and drove in three runs, helping the Houston Astros beat the Detroit Tigers 12-3 Thursday night to extend their winning streak to 11.

title: Kiermaier ends combined no-hit bid, Rays top Red Sox 1-0
description: Kevin Kiermaier broke up a combined no-hit bid by the Boston Red Sox with a one-out double in the eighth inning and Manuel Margot scored on a wild pitch in the ninth to give the Tampa Bay Rays a 1-0 victory Thursday night.

title: Schwarber's 11th, 12th HRs in 13 games lifts Nationals
description: Kyle Schwarber homered twice, raising his season total to 21 by hitting 12 in his past 13 games, and the Washington Nationals beat the Miami Marlins 7-3 Thursday night for their 10th win in 11 games.

title: Gurriel slam helps Jays send O's to 20th straight road loss
description: Lourdes Gurriel Jr. hit his first grand slam in a six-run first inning, Vladimir Guerrero Jr. took over sole possession of the home run lead with his 24th, and the Toronto Blue Jays extended Baltimore's road losing streak to 20 games by routing the Orioles 9-0 on Thursday night.

title: Indians' Eddie Rosario caught in bad baserunning blunder, redeems himself with clutch hit
description: Cleveland Indians outfielder Eddie Rosario had a bad baserunning blunder on Thursday night against the Minnesota Twins.

title: A's split with 5-1 win in Texas as Bassitt gets 8th W in row
description: Chris Bassitt is on quite a roll for the Oakland Athletics since being their opening day starter and then losing his first two games. He hasn’t lost since.

title: Judge, Sánchez drive Yanks to blowout win over Royals
description: Yankees hitters have clawed out of an early season slump with a string of clutch, late-game hits.

title: Cities stripped of minor league teams finding ways forward
description: Bert Parsley’s vision was bold and unusual — a 35,000 square-foot restaurant and event area adjoining a Harley Davidson dealership.

title: Surfside, Florida building collapse: Miami's pro sports teams lend helping hand to community in need
description: Miami sports teams lent a helping hand Thursday after a partial building collapse in Surfside, Florida, left one dead and nearly 100 unaccounted for.

title: MLB All-Star Game jerseys leave baseball fans in disbelief
description: The MLB All-Star Game jerseys were released Thursday.

title: San Francisco will require all city employees to be vaccinated against COVID-19: report
description: The city of San Francisco will mandate all city employees to be vaccinated against the coronavirus pending approval from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration.

title: Mexican League baseball game turns into all out brawl, bat and helmet tossed at pitcher
description: An irate Mexican League baseball player threw his bat and helmet at the opposing pitcher after he was hit by a pitch in a game Wednesday night.

title: Mets fans' applause for Tylor Megill turns to boos for umpire as pitcher gets inspected
description: New York Mets pitcher Tylor Megill made his major league debut on Wednesday night and held the Atlanta Braves to two runs in about five innings of work in the team’s 7-3 win.

title: Yankees' Zach Britton on substance checks: 'Optics are absolutely embarrassing for our game'
description: New York Yankees pitcher Zach Britton said Wednesday the constant inspections for grip-enhancing substances and the ensuing fights were not a good look for baseball going forward.

title: Padres beat Dodgers 5-3 for 1st sweep of rivals in 8 seasons
description: The last time the San Diego Padres swept the Los Angeles Dodgers at Petco Park, in September 2010, right-hander Joe Musgrove was just starting his senior year at Grossmont High in suburban El Cajon.

title: Lindor, Conforto, new pitchers lead Mets past Braves 7-3
description: With the arrival of Michael Conforto and a few other reinforcements, the banged-up New York Mets got back in the swing of things.

title: Sánchez, Voit lift Yankees over Royals 6-5 in thriller
description: Aroldis Chapman bent over sharply and cursed at himself after blowing a save with a four-pitch bases-loaded walk and falling behind on an infield single.

title: Rays stop 7-game skid, beat AL East-leading Red Sox 8-2
description: Austin Meadows, Mike Zunino and Brandon Lowe homered to help the Tampa Bay Rays stop a seven-game losing streak by beating the AL East-leading Boston Red Sox 8-2 on Wednesday night.

title: Astros club 4 HRs, beat Orioles 13-0 for 10th straight win
description: José Altuve silenced the booing fans at Camden Yards with a two-run homer, José Urquidy pitched seven innings of three-hit ball and the Houston Astros stretched their winning streak to 10 games by breezing past the Baltimore Orioles 13-0 Wednesday night.

title: Giants overcome Ohtani, rally in 13th for 9-3 win over Halos
description: By the time the San Francisco Giants got back to the clubhouse from a 13-inning marathon against the Los Angeles Angels, they were looking at starting pitcher Kevin Gausman a bit funny.

title: Rob Manfred on MLB's crackdown on foreign substances: 'The first two days have gone very well'
description: It’s been two days of chaos, but MLB Commissioner Rob Manfred seems encouraged.

title: Astros July giveaway features 2019 ALCS trophy, ring in series against Yankees
description: The Houston Astros were the butt of the joke back in May when they played the New York Yankees at home for the first time since Houston's sign-stealing scam was exposed but it seems like the Astros are returning the favor in a very subtle way.

title: Castro's 2-run single in 9th rallies Nats past Phils 13-12
description: Starlin Castro hit a go-ahead, two-run single off closer Hector Neris in the ninth inning and the Washington Nationals rallied three times to beat the Philadelphia Phillies 13-12 Wednesday.

title: Grandal, White Sox end 5-game skid, beat Pirates 4-3
description: Yasmani Grandal hit a two-run double and the Chicago White Sox stopped a five-game losing streak, beating the Pittsburgh Pirates 4-3 Wednesday.

title: Nationals' Max Scherzer wanted umpires to check Bryce Harper's hair for foreign substances
description: Washington Nationals ace Max Scherzer was on the mound against the Philadelphia Phillies on Tuesday night. With baseball’s new grip-enhancing substance checks in place, Scherzer was checked on three separate occasions for potentially using foreign substances.

title: Mets' Alonso joins Angels' Ohtani in All-Star Home Run Derby
description: The New York Mets' Pete Alonso will defend his Home Run Derby title at Coors Field on July 12.

title: Nationals GM labels Phillies' Joe Girardi as 'con artist' after Max Scherzer incident
description: Washington Nationals general manager Mike Rizzo had choice words for Philadelphia Phillies manager Joe Girardi after Tuesday night’s issue of Max Scherzer’s substance inspections.

title: Dodgers' Clayton Kershaw notes one issue with MLB's guidance on illegal substances
description: Los Angeles Dodgers pitcher Clayton Kershaw had an interesting take Tuesday night about Major League Baseball’s crackdown on grip-enhancing substances.

title: Former Phillies outfielder Dylan Cozens leaving MLB to pursue NFL 'dream'
description: Former Philadelphia Phillies outfielder Dylan Cozens is trading in his mitt for shoulder pads, announcing Tuesday that he intends to pursue his “dream” of playing in the NFL.

title: A's Sergio Romo drops his pants, throws gear during umpire's substance inspection
description: Oakland Athletics reliever Sergio Romo was another pitcher who appeared to be upset over umpires checking him for grip-enhancing substances during his outing against the Texas Rangers.

title: Nationals' Max Scherzer unhappy over substance checks: 'I'll take off all my clothes'
description: Washington Nationals pitcher Max Scherzer returned to the mound to face the Philadelphia Phillies on Tuesday night after a stint on the injury list and didn’t appear to be pleased with baseball’s constant grip-enhancing substance checks.

title: Snell pitches 5 scoreless innings, Padres beat Dodgers 3-2
description: With the sellout crowd of 42,667 on its feet in the ninth inning, right fielder Wil Myers chased down Justin Turner's slicing liner to end the San Diego Padres' 3-2 win against the rival Los Angeles Dodgers.

title: Cole's strikeouts, spin rate down, Royals rally past Yanks
description: Gerrit Cole walked off the mound slowly after the first inning, expecting to be stopped by umpires searching for banned sticky substances.

title: Morton earns 100th win, Stroman hurt as Braves blank Mets
description: Charlie Morton struck out 11 in seven innings of one-hit ball for his 100th major league win, and the Atlanta Braves beat the banged-up New York Mets 3-0 on Tuesday night for their second consecutive shutout against the slumping NL East leaders.

title: Athletics race to large, early lead, defeat Rangers 13-6
description: Matt Chapman and Ramon Laureano hit two-run home runs in the first two innings and Cole Irvin earned his second straight win as the Oakland A’s capitalized early on Texas’ unorthodox sequence of pitchers, racing to an early nine-run lead on the way to a 13-6 win over the Rangers on Tuesday night.

title: Hendricks dominates, Bryant homers as Cubs beat Indians 7-1
description: Kyle Hendricks isn't all that interested in labels. The results are what matters to him, and he sure is on quite a roll.

title: Greinke, Astros beat Orioles 3-1 for 9th straight win
description: Dusty Baker has been around long enough to know what it takes for a team to get on a lengthy winning streak.

title: Top prospect Wander Franco homers in MLB debut for Rays
description: Wander Franco, a 20-year-old infielder considered the best prospect in the minor leagues, homered for the Tampa Bay Rays in his major league debut, connecting for a three-run drive against Boston on Tuesday night.

title: Mets' Conforto ready to return, but Lucchesi out for season
description: The New York Mets got some mixed injury news on Tuesday.

title: Indians expect MLB wins leader Civale to be out with injury
description: Cleveland Indians right-hander Aaron Civale appears headed to the injured list because of soreness in the middle finger on his pitching hand, another major hit for a banged-up staff.

title: Naquin's 3-run homer in 9th gives Reds 10-7 win over Twins
description: Tyler Naquin went 4 for 4 with a three-run home run that broke a ninth-inning tie right after the ragged Cincinnati bullpen lost a five-run lead, and the Reds beat the Minnesota Twins 10-7 to stop their five-game losing streak on Tuesday afternoon.

title: Buxton's bad luck: Twins star shelved again, has broken hand
description: The glimpses of Byron Buxton's game-changing, worth-the-admission skills have grown broader over the last three years as the Minnesota Twins center fielder has blossomed with the bat to match his long-superior work with the glove.

title: Mets' Jacob deGrom among the first to be inspected after MLB's substance crackdown
description: New York Mets star Jacob deGrom was among the first pitchers to get checked for grip-enhancing substances as Major League Baseball’s directive went into effect Monday.

title: Darvish fans 11, Padres get 2 big homers to beat Dodgers 6-2
description: Yu Darvish said he never envisioned himself as an ace until recently.

title: Astros take combined no-hitter into 8th, rout Orioles 10-2
description: Jake Odorizzi pitched five outstanding innings in another sign of progress after his arm issues, and Houston won its eighth straight game.

title: Kelly helps D-backs end 17-game skid, beat Brewers 5-1
description: Ketel Marte camped under the high fly ball in center field and watched as it fell into his glove. Relief pitcher Joakim Soria smacked his hands together, grinned and walked toward catcher Stephen Vogt, who pumped his arms in a little victory dance.

title: DeGrom dominates after shoulder scare, Mets beat Braves 4-2
description: Jacob deGrom shouldered the load for New York in his return from another injury scare, pitching one-hit ball over five scoreless innings as the Mets beat the Atlanta Braves 4-2 Monday to open a doubleheader.

title: Mets fire 2 high-ranking employees after workplace review
description: The New York Mets have fired two high-ranking employees and will overhaul their legal and human resources departments on the recommendation of independent investigators hired to review the organization following allegations of sexual misconduct against former manager Mickey Callaway.

title: World Series MVP Ben Zobrist claims in lawsuit wife had affair with their former pastor
description: Former Chicago Cubs star Ben Zobrist alleged in a lawsuit that his wife, Julianna, had an affair with a former Tennessee pastor.

title: Rays to call up Wander Franco to the bigs, will be only active player born in 2001
description: The Tampa Bay Rays are set to call up Wander Franco to the big leagues ahead of the start of their series against the Boston Red Sox on Tuesday.

title: Andy Reid look-alike makes appearance at Royals game, stuns fans
description: Did Andy Reid trade in his Kansas City Chiefs’ red and yellow for royal blue?

title: Smyly, Acuña fuel Braves past Cards to split doubleheader
description: Drew Smyly didn’t allow a hit until the sixth inning, Ronald Acuña Jr. hit his 100th career homer and the Atlanta Braves earned a split of a day-night doubleheader with a 1-0 victory over the St. Louis Cardinals on Sunday night.

title: Pujols passes Ott for runs, Diamondbacks' skid reaches 17
description: Albert Pujols hit a three-run homer and passed Mel Ott for 14th on the career runs list, and the Los Angeles Dodgers extended the Arizona Diamondbacks' losing streak to 17 game with a 9-8 victory Sunday.

title: Tigers overcome Ohtani's 23rd HR, hold off Angels 5-3 in 10
description: Shohei Ohtani hit his sixth homer in six games for the Angels, but Daz Cameron hit a two-run single in the 10th inning and the Detroit Tigers avoided a four-game series sweep with a 5-3 victory over Los Angeles on Sunday.

title: Long grand slam in 10th, Mariners sweep Rays in 4-game set
description: Shed Long Jr. hit a grand slam with two outs in the 10th inning, lifting the Seattle Mariners over the Tampa Bay Rays 6-2 on Sunday for a four-game sweep.

title: Padres beat Reds 3-2 behind Myers, Lamet, for 4-game sweep
description: Wil Myers hit a two-run triple and scored on Joey Votto's errant throw as the San Diego Padres beat the Cincinnati Reds 3-2 Sunday for a four-game sweep.

title: Dyson double caps 10-pitch AB, Royals top Red Sox 7-3
description: Jarrod Dyson capped a 10-pitch at-bat with a tiebreaking, two-run double in a three-run third inning off Nathan Eovaldi, and the Kansas City Royals rallied to beat the Boston Red Sox 7-3 Sunday for their first series win in nearly three weeks.

title: Buxton, Maeda, Twins win 4th in row; Texas skid hits 6
description: Byron Buxton launched an early two-run homer into the second deck, Kenta Maeda earned his first win since May 3 and the Minnesota Twins beat the reeling Texas Rangers 4-2 Sunday for their fourth straight win.

title: Wainwright pitches 3-hitter, Cards top Braves 9-1 in opener
description: Adam Wainwright struck out 11 and pitched a three-hitter, sending the St. Louis Cardinals over the Atlanta Braves 9-1 Sunday in the first game of a day-night doubleheader.

title: McGuire hits 3 doubles as Ryu, Blue Jays beat Orioles 7-4
description: Reese McGuire had three doubles during a four-hit performance, leading Hyun Jin Ryu and the Toronto Blue Jays past the Baltimore Orioles 7-4 Sunday.

title: Schwarber hits 3 homers, Nats beat Mets 5-2, take 3 of 4
description: Kyle Schwarber homered three times and tied a major league record with five in a two-game span, leading the Washington Nationals over the New York Mets 5-2 Sunday to take three of four in the series.

title: Yankees turn game-ending triple-play, beat A's 2-1
description: The New York Yankees turned their record-tying third triple play of the season to strand the go-ahead run in the ninth inning, bailing out closer Aroldis Chapman in a shaky outing and closing down a 2-1 win over the Oakland Athletics on Sunday.

title: Get a grip: Pitchers unsure on eve of sticky stuff crackdown
description: Gerrit Cole hardly expects a smooth transition when Major League Baseball ups its efforts against sticky substances.

title: Joey Votto apologizes to tearful young Reds fan for ejection with signed ball
description: Cincinnati Reds star Joey Votto sent a written apology on a signed baseball to a tearful young fan to make up for getting tossed in the first inning of Saturday’s game in San Diego.

title: 'Hero' Capitol Police Officer Eugene Goodman to throw out first pitch before Nationals game
description: U.S. Capitol Police Officer Eugene Goodman will throw out the first pitch before Friday night’s Washington Nationals game.

title: Rays prospect Tyler Zombro shows off giant head scar week after line-drive incident
description: Tampa Bay Rays pitching prospect Tyler Zombro tweeted updates Thursday of his progress in the hospital after taking a line drive to the head during a game last week.

title: Yankees DJ LeMahieu supports MLB's crackdown of grip-enhancing substances
description: New York Yankees infielder D.J. LeMahieu appeared to be one of the few voices coming out in support of Major League Baseball’s crackdown on pitchers using grip-enhancing substances.

title: Mariners score 2 in 9th to rally past Rays 6-5
description: Shed Long Jr. hit a tying double in the bottom of the ninth inning and pinch-hitter Kyle Seager singled home the winning run to rally the Seattle Mariners past the Tampa Bay Rays 6-5 on Thursday night.

title: Ohtani, backed by Ward's slam, leads Angels past Tigers 7-5
description: Shohei Ohtani hadn't pitched in front of a full, rowdy crowd at Angel Stadium since he was a major league rookie three years ago, and he had missed the feeling.

title: Caratini, Hosmer HR in 9th, Padres seesaw past Reds 6-4
description: The first sellout crowd at Petco Park since 2019 was treated to Fernando Tatis Jr.'s electrifying solo home run in the sixth inning and Victor Caratini's game-winning, two-run shot in the ninth.

title: Stanton HR, triple play key Yankees' 8-4 win over Blue Jays
description: Giancarlo Stanton hit a go-ahead homer in a four-run seventh inning and the New York Yankees pulled off a wacky triple play Thursday night in an 8-4 win over the reeling Toronto Blue Jays.

title: Altuve homers again, Astros beat White Sox 10-2
description: Jose Altuve homered for the fourth time in three games, Michael Brantley and Abraham Toro also connected, and the Houston Astros beat the Chicago White Sox 10-2 on Thursday night.

title: Morton takes no-hitter into 7th, Braves beat Cardinals 4-0
description: Charlie Morton didn't allow a hit until the seventh inning and took a shutout into the eighth, lifting the Atlanta Braves over the St. Louis Cardinals 4-0 on Thursday night.

title: Yankees turn triple play, take advantage of Blue Jays' poor baserunning
description: The New York Yankees took advantage of the Toronto Blue Jays’ poor baserunning and they turned an incredible triple play during their game on Thursday.

title: Joyless Journey: D-backs' 23rd straight road loss sets mark
description: The Arizona Diamondbacks set a major league record with their 23rd straight road loss, making dubious history in getting trounced by the San Francisco Giants 10-3 Thursday.

title: MLB loosens COVID restrictions, drops masks for vaccinated
description: All fully vaccinated players and staff can stop wearing masks in dugouts, bullpens and clubhouses under the latest change to Major League Baseball's coronavirus protocols.

title: Mets' deGrom gets clean MRI on shoulder, no plans for IL
description: Mets ace Jacob deGrom's shoulder showed no abnormalities, but New York was not yet ready to commit to him taking his next turn in the rotation on Sunday against Washington.

title: Indians send Orioles to 19th straight road loss, 10-3
description: José Ramírez and Bobby Bradley homered during a three-run first inning and the Cleveland Indians beat the Orioles 10-3 on Thursday, extending Baltimore’s road losing streak to 19 games.

title: Yankees' Gerrit Cole after MLB's crackdown: 'It's so hard to grip the ball'
description: New York Yankees star Gerrit Cole struck out four batters and allowed two runs in eight innings during the team’s 3-2 victory over the Toronto Blue Jays on Wednesday night.

title: Scott Boras demands clarification over MLB's sticky substance guidance
description: Scott Boras, who is among the top agents in baseball, took issue with Major League Baseball cracking down on grip-enhancing substances in a lengthy statement Wednesday.

title: Tigers' Casey Mize forced to change glove over its color: Timing was 'was pretty s—tty, honestly'
description: Detroit Tigers pitcher Casey Mize was frustrated with an umpire Tuesday night during his outing against the Kansas City Royals amid MLB’s crackdown on foreign substances.

title: Wheeler, Hoskins lead Phillies past Kershaw, Dodgers 2-0
description: Zack Wheeler outpitched Clayton Kershaw, and Rhys Hoskins homered early to end an 0-for-33 slump as the Philadelphia Phillies beat the Los Angeles Dodgers 2-0 on Wednesday night to avoid a three-game sweep.

title: D-backs match MLB record with 22nd straight road loss
description: Hours before first pitch, many of the Arizona Diamondbacks were busy working in an outdoor weight room at Oracle Park as others prepared for their pregame fielding drills.

title: Civale wins 10th, Indians deal O's 18th straight road loss
description: Aaron Civale became the first pitcher with 10 wins this season and José Ramírez homered and drove in three runs as the Cleveland Indians beat the Orioles 8-7 Wednesday night, extending Baltimore’s road losing streak to 18 games.

title: Arroyo's pinch slam sends surging Red Sox past Braves, 10-8
description: Christian Arroyo relished delivering the big hit Wednesday night. After reviewing the tape, he thinks his celebration needs some work.

title: Altuve slugs way into MLB history as Astros down Rangers 8-4
description: José Altuve started this game the same way he ended the one before.

title: Cole, Sánchez, Chapman come through as Yanks edge Blue Jays
description: Gerrit Cole pitched eight effective innings, pinch-hitter Gary Sánchez connected for a two-run homer and Aroldis Chapman dodged trouble in the ninth as the New York Yankees held off the Toronto Blue Jays 3-2 on Wednesday night.

title: Mets' deGrom pulled with shoulder soreness amid another gem
description: Mets ace Jacob deGrom left his start Wednesday night with right shoulder soreness after three perfect innings, yet another injury scare for the two-time NL Cy Young Award winner amid a historic start to this season.

title: Journeyman Espino pitches Nationals to sweep of Pirates
description: Paolo Espino got his first major league win at age 34, Josh Bell hit a two-run homer against his former team and the Washington Nationals beat the Pittsburgh Pirates 3-1 on Wednesday for a three-game sweep.

title: Blackmon, Rockies shake off Tatis' 477-foot HR, beat Padres
description: Pinch-hitter Charlie Blackmon singled home the winning run in the ninth inning and the Colorado Rockies shook off a monster homer by Fernando Tatis Jr. to beat the stumbling San Diego Padres 8-7 on Wednesday.

title: Laureano HR, nifty catch in return, streaking A’s top Angels
description: Ramón Laureano hit a home run and made a homer-robbing catch in his return from the injured list, and the Oakland Athletics rallied past the Los Angeles Angels 8-4 Wednesday for their sixth straight win.

title: Castro HR, Tigers rally for sweep over skidding Royals
description: Willi Castro homered during a three-run rally in the seventh inning and the Detroit Tigers beat the Kansas City Royals 6-5 Wednesday for a three-game sweep.

title: Grandal's single in 10th gives White Sox 8-7 win over Rays
description: Yasmani Grandal hit a game-ending RBI single in the 10th inning and the Chicago White Sox beat Tampa Bay 8-7 on Wednesday, taking two of three from the Rays in a matchup of division leaders.

Zeuch into the left-field fountains, breaking open a scoreless game and sending the Kansas City Royals to a 2-0 victory over the Blue Jays on Sunday.
