description: The Los Angeles Angels granted the Chicago White Sox permission to interview Hall of Famer Tony La Russa for their managing job, a person familiar with the situation said Wednesday.

title: Senators take aim as Astros on the brink of ACLS elimination during Barrett confirmation hearing
description: The Houston Astros are just one game away from being swept in the ALCS but the Senate Judiciary committee spared them no kind words on Wednesday during Supreme Court nominee Amy Coney Barrett's confirmation hearing.

title: Video shows Padres' Tommy Pham moments after stabbing outside California gentlemen's club
description: New video surfaced Wednesday showing the moments after San Diego Padres outfielder Tommy Pham was stabbed in the lower back when a fight broke out in the parking lot of a gentlemen’s club Sunday night.

title: Rays beat Astros 5-2, move within 1 victory of World Series
description: Kevin Kiermaier and the Tampa Bay Rays — with big assists from two former Padres who know Petco Park's outfield well — are one win from the second World Series berth in franchise history.

title: Freeman, Albies HR again, Braves hang on for 2-0 NLCS lead
description: Ozzie Albies homered into the Braves bullpen in the ninth inning for the second straight night, and Mark Melancon once again caught the ball on the fly.

title: Greinke says he prefers playing without fans in ballparks
description: Houston Astros pitcher Zack Greinke said he’s enjoyed playing games without fans during the pandemic-shortened season and in the playoffs.

title: Dodgers' Clayton Kershaw scratched from Game 2 start in NLCS
description: Clayton Kershaw was scratched Tuesday from his start for the Los Angeles Dodgers in Game 2 of the NL Championship Series due to back spasms.

title: Riley HR in 9th leads Braves past Dodgers 5-1 in NLCS opener
description: Atlanta Braves fans were still doing tomahawk-chop chants as they filed out of the stadium, real people who replaced the cardboard cutouts players got so accustomed to this season.

title: San Diego Padres outfielder Tommy Pham stabbed, will recover
description: San Diego Padres outfielder Tommy Pham is recovering after he was stabbed in the back Sunday night, authorities said.

title: Altuve's 2 early throwing errors doom Astros in ALCS Game 2
description: Whether they're in the field or at the plate, the Houston Astros are finding it tough to summon their usual postseason proficiency so far in the AL Championship Series.

title: Margot's homer, catch highlight Rays' 4-2 win over Astros
description: Manuel Margot hit a three-run home run one batter after a crucial Houston error and made a spectacular catch in right field in his former home ballpark, and the Tampa Bay Rays beat the Astros 4-2 Monday to take a 2-0 lead in the AL Championship Series.

title: 2020 NL Championship Series Preview, schedule and times
description: The National League Championship Series begins on Monday when the Los Angeles Dodgers square off against the Atlanta Braves at Globe Life Field in Arlington, Tx.

title: White Sox, Renteria agree to split after breakout season
description: The Chicago White Sox and manager Rick Renteria have agreed to split following a disappointing finish to a breakout season in which the team made the playoffs for the first time in 12 years.

title: Joe Morgan, driving force of Big Red Machine, dead at 77
description: Joe Morgan, the Hall of Fame second baseman who became the sparkplug of the Big Red Machine and the prototype for baseball’s artificial turf era, has died. He was 77.

title: Arozarena homers again, Rays beat Astros 2-1 in ALCS opener
description: Tampa Bay reliever Diego Castillo played catch Sunday afternoon, less than 48 hours after throwing 29 pitches in two innings, and told manager Kevin Cash he was good to go for the opener of the AL Championship Series against Houston.

title: 2020 AL Championship Series preview, schedule and times
description: The American League Championship Series begins Sunday night when the Tampa Bay Rays take on the Houston Astros at Petco Park in San Diego.

title: Yankees superstar's girlfriend pleads guilty to DUI
description: The girlfriend of Yankees slugger Aaron Judge pleaded guilty to misdemeanor DUI after cutting a deal with prosecutors, TMZ reported Saturday.

title: Tampa Bay Rays advance to ALCS after eliminating New York Yankees
description: Mike Brosseau homered off Aroldis Chapman with one out in the eighth inning and the Tampa Bay Rays beat the New York Yankees 2-1 Friday night to reach the AL Championship Series for the first time in 12 seasons.

title: Whitey Ford, New York Yankees pitching great, dead at 91, team announces
description: Whitey Ford, one of the most talented pitchers in baseball history, who helped lead the New York Yankees to a string of World Series wins in the 1950s and '60s, has died, the team announced Friday. He was 91.

title: Voit, Torres homer as Yankees beat Rays 5-1 to force Game 5
description: The New York Yankees didn't flinch under the pressure of an elimination game and got the AL Division Series against Tampa Bay into the hands of ace Gerrit Cole for the decisive Game 5.

title: MLB-best Dodgers to 14th NLCS after 12-3 win to sweep Padres
description: Justin Turner and the Los Angeles Dodgers have completed the first step of what they hope is a long stay in the Lone Star State.

title: Astros back in the ALCS months removed from cheating-scandal fallout
description: Cheating scandal be damned, the Houston Astros are back in the American League Championship Series.

title: Wright, d'Arnaud lead Braves to sweep Marlins, reach NLCS
description: Not since the days of John Smoltz, Greg Maddux and Tom Glavine had the Atlanta Braves pitched like this in the playoffs.

title: Astros' Greinke holds up 2 fingers, then allows HR on slider
description: Houston pitcher Zack Greinke held up two fingers toward Oakland's Ramón Laureano and Astros catcher Martín Maldonado in the second inning of their AL Division Series Game 4 on Thursday, and Laureano hit a hanging slider 440 feet to left for a tiebreaking three-run homer.

title: Jackie Robinson's daughter opposes President Trump's campaign ad featuring her father: 'We’re insulted'
description: President Trump released a campaign ad on Tuesday, which featured an image of baseball legend Jackie Robinson, who broke the color barrier and became the first Black man to play in Major League Baseball.

title: Indians' Terry Francona opens up on health issues: 'It was getting a little hairy there'
description: Cleveland Indians manager Terry Francona revealed Wednesday he underwent multiple surgeries over the last few months, which cost him most of the shortened 2020 season.

title: Bellinger robs Padres as Dodgers hold on for 2-0 NLDS lead
description: Cody Bellinger would take the homer-robbing catch over the home run he hit if he had to pick from the two. The Los Angeles Dodgers needed both from their MVP center fielder.

title: Arozarena powers Rays past Yanks 8-4 for 2-1 lead in ALDS
description: The Tampa Bay Rays are unanimous in their praise of Randy Arozarena, who is living up to his nickname, “The Cuban Rocket."

title: Pinder's HR helps rally A's past Astros 9-7, trail ALDS 2-1
description: Chad Pinder tied the score with a three-run homer in the seventh inning, Sean Murphy hit a go-ahead sacrifice fly in the eighth and the Oakland Athletics rallied past the Houston Astros 9-7 on Wednesday to avoid elimination in their AL Division Series.

title: Clevinger replaced on Padres playoff roster with elbow issue
description: Mike Clevinger was replaced on San Diego's playoff roster Wednesday because of his elbow injury, a move that would keep him from pitching again this postseason unless the Padres make it to the World Series.

title: Anderson sharp, Markakis alert, Braves blank Miami, lead 2-0
description: Rookie Ian Anderson pitched like a poised veteran, right fielder Nick Markakis made a nifty defensive play late and the Atlanta Braves threw another playoff shutout, beating the Miami Marlins 2-0 Wednesday for a 2-0 lead in the NL Division Series.

title: Stanton's 2 big homers not enough to power Yankees in Game 2
description: Giancarlo Stanton's second homer Tuesday night left his bat at 118 mph with a ferocious crack. Players on both teams gaped from the dugouts while the three-run shot rocketed a projected 458 feet to the empty patio atop the highest level of outfield seats at Petco Park.

title: Padres manager Tingler ejected from NLDS Game 1 vs LA
description: San Diego Padres manager Jayce Tingler was ejected by home plate umpire Lance Barrett in the sixth inning of Game 1 of the NL Division Series against the Los Angeles Dodgers while making his sixth pitching change Tuesday night.

title: Walk in new park: Dodgers open NLDS with 5-1 win over Padres
description: Justin Turner and the Los Angeles Dodgers had a walk in the new park to start their National League Division Series.

title: Springer hits 2 HRs, Astros beat A's 5-2 for 2-0 ALDS lead
description: George Springer hit two homers and the Houston Astros kept making more noise in the playoffs, beating the Oakland Athletics 5-2 on Tuesday to take a 2-0 lead in their AL Division Series.

title: Acuña HR, plunked again, Braves top Marlins 9-5 to open NLDS
description: Ronald Acuña Jr. made history with a leadoff home run to start things off for the Atlanta Braves in their NL Division Series opener against Miami.

title: Padres get back Mike Clevinger, Dodgers add pitcher for NLDS
description: Right-hander Mike Clevinger is on the 28-player roster for the San Diego Padres for the NL Division Series and starting Game 1 against the Los Angeles Dodgers after missing the first round of the playoffs.

title: Milwaukee scraps early voting plans at Fiserv, Miller Park
description: Election officials said Tuesday that they scrapped their plans to use the Milwaukee Bucks and Brewers' stadiums as early voting sites in the presidential battleground state of Wisconsin, citing fear that the ballots could be legally challenged.

title: Stanton, Yankees power way to 9-3 win against Rays in opener
description: Giancarlo Stanton hit a grand slam in the ninth inning for New York's fourth home run of the game, and the Yankees beat the Tampa Bay Rays 9-3 Monday night in the opener of their AL Division Series at Petco Park.

title: 2020 NL Division Series preview, schedule and times
description: The National League Division series starts Tuesday with the Los Angeles Dodgers taking on the San Diego Padres and the Atlanta Braves facing off against the Miami Marlins.

title: Padres look for grand time vs rival Dodgers in NLDS at Texas
description: The San Diego Padres have already had a grand time in the new Texas ballpark. They are back there after a lot of postseason relief with another chance to overtake the NL West rival Los Angeles Dodgers.

title: Springer, Correa rally Astros past A's 10-5 in ALDS opener
description: Carlos Correa homered twice and drove in four, Jose Altuve hit a go-ahead, two-run single during Houston's four-run sixth inning and the Astros rallied to beat the Oakland Athletics 10-5 in the opener of their AL Division Series on Monday at Dodger Stadium.

title: Supreme Court allows minor leaguers' class action over pay
description: The Supreme Court is allowing a class-action lawsuit to proceed from minor league baseball players who allege they are being paid less than minimum wage.

title: 2020 AL Division Series preview, schedule and times
description: The American League Division Series starts Monday with the Tampa Bay Rays taking on the New York Yankees and the Oakland Athletics playing the Houston Astros.

title: Astros out to 'silence the haters' in ALDS against Athletics
description: Josh Reddick and the rest of the Houston Astros heard the “cheaters” chants and banging on garbage cans as the team's buses pulled into Dodger Stadium for a series last month.

title: Rays' Kiermaier: `They don’t like us, we don’t like them'
description: After losing eight of 10 games in a contentious regular-season series, the New York Yankees just can’t shake the AL East rival Tampa Bay Rays.

title: Ex-MLB pitcher Charles Haeger found dead after sought in woman's shooting death
description: The body of Charles Haeger, a former Major League Baseball pitcher, was found Saturday afternoon as he was being sought in the shooting death of his ex-girlfriend, authorities said Saturday.

title: Aaron Boone managing Yankees in family hometown San Diego
description: In a 2020 season that has had all sorts of odd twists, Aaron Boone will be managing the New York Yankees in an AL Division Series in an NL ballpark in the city where the Boone family dynasty has its roots.

title: Klentak out as Phils GM after 3rd straight September slump
description: Matt Klentak's inability to lead the Philadelphia Phillies to the postseason or even a single winning season cost him his job as general manager.

title: Lou Johnson, who played major role in Dodgers' 1965 World Series win, dies at 86
description: Lou Johnson, a former Los Angeles Dodgers outfielder who played a critical role for the team in Game 7 of the 1965 World Series, died Thursday night at his home. He was 86.

title: Rays' Kevin Kiermaier tries to fan flames of so-called rivalry with Yankees ahead of postseason series
description: Tampa Bay Rays outfielder Kevin Kiermaier tried to conjure up some sort of rivalry with the New York Yankees on Friday as he prepared for the upcoming series against the Bronx Bombers.

title: Kennesaw Mountain Landis' name removed from baseball's MVP plaques over racist past
description: Kennesaw Mountain Landis’ name will be removed from the American and National League MVP trophies after 75 years of being etched on the plaques given to the players voted to be the best in baseball.

title: 9 Padres pitchers blank Cardinals 4-0 in Game 3, reach NLDS
description: Craig Stammen and eight fellow relievers combined on a four-hitter in a brilliant, record-setting effort that sent the San Diego Padres over the St. Louis Cardinals 4-0 Friday night in the deciding Game 3 of their NL wild-card series.

title: Legendary pitcher Bob Gibson, 84, dies after battle with pancreatic cancer
description: Bob Gibson, a Hall of Fame pitcher who played his entire career with the St. Louis Cardinals died Friday.

title: Cooper homers, Sanchez dominates, Marlins knock out Cubs 2-0
description: The Miami Marlins didn't need a hand from a fan at Wrigley Field to knock the Chicago Cubs out of the playoffs this time. They did just fine on their own, and they showed they're hardly bottom feeders.

title: Avila says Tigers aren't ruling out Hinch, Cora for manager
description: Tigers general manager Al Avila said Friday that Detroit is not ruling out the possibility of hiring A.J. Hinch or Alex Cora for its manager vacancy.

title: Francisco Lindor: 'Of course' Indians could afford big-money contract
description: Francisco Lindor’s future with the Cleveland Indians is very much up in the air after the team was eliminated from the MLB Postseason by the New York Yankees.

title: Babe Ruth's mythical 'Called Shot' retold by Lou Gehrig days later in newly released audio
description: One of the most prominent stories in baseball folklore is New York Yankees legend Babe Ruth calling his shot in Game 3 of the 1932 World Series against the Chicago Cubs and then executing with a home run.

title: Streak breaker: Braves win first playoff series since 2001
description: Picture this: The Atlanta Braves winning a playoff series for the first time in nearly a generation.

title: Kershaw Ks 13 as Dodgers eliminate Brewers 3-0
description: Beat up in the postseason over the years, Clayton Kershaw orchestrated one of his best performances against the weakened Milwaukee Brewers.

title: Tatis, Myers homer twice, Padres stay alive with 11-9 win
description: Fernando Tatis Jr. had been waiting for a breakout game, and boy did “El Niño” get it.

title: Pinder delivers timely hit, A's advance in playoffs at last
description: The Oakland Athletics ended 14 years of postseason futility, riding Chad Pinder’s go-ahead, two-run single in the fifth inning and repeated costly walks by Chicago’s relievers to rally past the White Sox 6-4 on Thursday and win the decisive third game of their AL wild-card round series.

title: Anderson shines, Braves shut out Reds again to sweep series
description: Ian Anderson dazzled in another shutout performance for Atlanta, and the Braves won a playoff series for the first time in almost two decades by sweeping the light-hitting Cincinnati Reds with a 5-0 victory Thursday.

title: Game 2 of Marlins-Cubs wild-card series postponed
description: The Chicago Cubs are counting on Yu Darvish to help them avoid a playoff sweep by the Miami Marlins.

title: Astros' Carlos Correa addresses the haters after sweeping Twins in AL Wild Card series
description: Carlos Correa was feeling confident after driving in the tie- breaking run that helped the Houston Astros advance past the Minnesota Twins in Wednesday’s Wild Card Series game, and he took it as an opportunity to address the haters.

title: Mariah Carey gushes over ex Derek Jeter in new book, calls their past romance 'so sensual’
description: Mariah Carey got candid about the intimate details of her brief relationship with Derek Jeter in her new memoir.

title: Pair arrested at Progressive Field for trespassing during Indians-Yankees postseason game
description: Two men were arrested at Progressive Field in Cleveland on Wednesday night as the Indians and the New York Yankees battled in a marathon Game 2 of the American League Wild Card Series.

title: Yanks sweep Indians 10-9 in draining game, meet Rays in ALDS
description: It took the New York Yankees nearly five hours on the field, carried them from Wednesday to Thursday and September into October to complete the sweep.

title: Seager homers, Dodgers beat Brewers 4-2 in playoff opener
description: The Los Angeles Dodgers' powerful lineup went mostly quiet against the Milwaukee Brewers. Still, baseball's best team in the regular season generated just enough offense and got plenty of help from the opposing pitcher.

title: Goldschmidt, Cardinals win 7-4 in Padres' return to playoffs
description: Paul Goldschmidt hit a two-run home run during a four-run first inning, St. Louis' bullpen held strong after starter Kwang Hyun Kim stumbled in his playoff debut and the Cardinals ruined the San Diego Padres’ long-awaited return to the playoffs with a 7-4 victory Wednesday in the opener of their NL wild-card series.

title: Renfroe slam helps Rays sweep young Blue Jays in 1st round
description: Hunter Renfroe hit a grand slam and the top-seeded Tampa Bay Rays won a postseason series for the first time in 12 years, overpowering the young Toronto Blue Jays 8-2 Wednesday to finish a two-game sweep of their AL wild-card matchup.

title: September Madness: MLB stages 8 playoff games in 1 day
description: Shortly after noon in Atlanta, Nick Senzel of the Cincinnati Reds slapped the first pitch from Max Fried to right field for a single, starting a day of baseball unlike any that had come before.

title: Fans to be allowed at World Series, NLCS in Arlington, Texas
description: Fans can take themselves out to the ball game for the first time this season during the NL Championship Series and World Series at new Globe Life Field in Arlington, Texas.

title: A's hold off Abreu, White Sox 5-3, force series to Game 3
description: Marcus Semien and Khris Davis homered early and the Oakland Athletics held off José Abreu and the Chicago White Sox in the late innings for a 5-3 win Wednesday that sent their AL playoff series to a deciding Game 3.

title: Dickerson homers as Marlins beat Cubs 5-1 in playoff opener
description: Corey Dickerson hit a three-run homer off a fading Kyle Hendricks in the seventh inning, and the Miami Marlins beat the Chicago Cubs 5-1 on Wednesday in Game 1 of their NL wild-card series.

title: Republicans don't want Bucks, Brewers at early voting sites
description: The chairman of the Wisconsin Republican Party warned Milwaukee's chief elections official that it would be illegal for any Milwaukee Bucks or Brewers players or mascots, including the Brewers' famous racing sausages, to participate in early voting events planned at their stadiums in the days leading up to the election.

title: Finally! Freeman leads Braves over Reds 1-0 in 13 innings
description: Freddie Freeman singled home the winning run in the 13th inning, finally ending the longest scoreless duel in postseason history as the Atlanta Braves defeated the Cincinnati Reds 1-0 in the opener of their NL wild-card series on Wednesday.

title: Reds, Braves set postseason record for scoring futility
description: The Cincinnati Reds and Atlanta Braves are playing the longest scoreless game in postseason history.

title: Injuries keep Clevinger, Lamet off Padres' wild-card roster
description: Starting pitchers Mike Clevinger and Dinelson Lamet were left off the San Diego Padres’ 28-man roster for their wild card series against the St. Louis Cardinals due to injuries that forced them out of their final regular-season starts.

title: Snell sharp, Margot HR, Rays beat Blue Jays 3-1 in opener
description: Beyond ace lefty Blake Snell, the small-market Tampa Bay Rays are light on household names.

title: No debate: Judge, Yankees pound Bieber, Indians in opener
description: Aaron Judge smashed a tone-setting, two-run homer on Shane Bieber's fourth pitch, Gerrit Cole struck out 13 and the New York Yankees opened the AL playoffs with a resounding 12-3 win over the Cleveland Indians on Tuesday night.

title: Giolito dazzles, Abreu slugs White Sox past A's in opener
description: Lucas Giolito dazzled in his postseason debut, stymieing the Oakland Athletics through six perfect innings and sending the Chicago White Sox to a 4-1 victory in the opener of their best-of-three wild-card series Tuesday.

title: Astros win 4-1 in Game 1; Twins' record losing streak at 17
description: Jose Altuve drew a bases-loaded walk to force in the go-ahead run in the ninth inning for Houston after a two-out error by shortstop Jorge Polanco, and the Astros beat Minnesota 4-1 Tuesday to open their AL playoff series and stretch the Twins' all-time record postseason losing streak to 17 games.

title: Lots of unfamiliar territory in 2020 baseball playoffs
description: Mookie Betts, meet Devin Williams and his devastating changeup. Aaron Judge, take a closer look at a much improved Shane Bieber. Fernando Tatis Jr., say hello to Jack Flaherty.

title: Yankees take on Indians in postseason and will have to contend with midges again
description: The New York Yankees will not only have to deal with the upstart Cleveland Indians in the American League Wild Card Series but they will face off again against an old foe – midges.

title: Indians' Shane Bieber captures American League pitching Triple Crown
description: Shane Bieber became the first American League pitcher to win the Triple Crown since Johan Santana did it for the Minnesota Twins in 2006.

title: Chiefs' Patrick Mahomes values playing in Kansas City over cities like New York: 'They care about the person you are'
description: The New York sports scene is not for the faint of heart and for Patrick Mahomes, it's something he witnessed firsthand -- which likely influenced the trajectory of his career.

title: 2020 NL Wild Card Series preview, schedule and times
description: The National League side of the MLB Postseason bracket is set as the beginning of the end of the shortened 2020 season is about to take place.

title: 2020 AL Wild Card Series preview, schedule and times
description: For the first in MLB history, there are eight teams in the playoffs for the AL side.

title: Cardinals beat Brewers, both clinch postseason berths
description: Harrison Bader tripled and homered to help the St. Louis Cardinals clinch a postseason berth on the final day of the regular season with a 5-2 win over Milwaukee, and the Brewers also earned a playoff spot Sunday via help on the West Coast moments later.

title: LeMahieu, Soto batting champs in shortest season in century
description: DJ LeMahieu became the first player to win undisputed batting titles in both leagues and Juan Soto the youngest NL champion as Major League Baseball’s shortest regular season since 1878 ended Sunday.

title: Angels fire GM Billy Eppler after 5 straight losing seasons
description: The Los Angeles Angels fired general manager Billy Eppler on Sunday after the long-struggling franchise finished its fifth consecutive losing season under his watch.

title: Roenicke fired by Red Sox after 1 pandemic-shortened season
description: Ron Roenicke waited five years after his previous managerial job for another opportunity.

title: Mets players reflect on missing the postseason: 'We had a lot of talent and we just didn’t do it'
description: The New York Mets have not made the playoffs since 2016 when the team lost its National League Wildcard game to the San Francisco Giants.

title: White Sox P Cordero suspended 3 games for hitting Contreras
description: Major League Baseball suspended Chicago White Sox reliever Jimmy Cordero for three games Saturday and fined him an undisclosed amount for hitting the Cubs' Willson Contreras with a pitch.

title: LeMahieu batting title, Voit HR crown near as Yanks win
description: DJ LaMahieu moved into position to become the first player to earn undisputed batting titles in both leagues, Luke Voit hit his major league-leading 22nd homer and the New York Yankees rediscovered their power in a 11-4 win over the Miami Marlins on Saturday.

title: From Mideast to AL East: Orioles’ Israeli prospect blooms
description: Dean Kremer is a budding celebrity in Israel and a developing star in the big leagues.

title: Nationals, manager Martinez agree to multiyear extension
description: Manager Dave Martinez and the Washington Nationals agreed to a multiyear contract extension that the team announced Saturday.

title: Marlins clinch 1st playoff berth since 2003, beat Yanks 4-3
description: Forced from the field by COVID-19, the Miami Marlins returned with enough force to reach the playoffs for the first time since their 2003 championship.

title: Astros clinch final AL playoff spot despite loss to Rangers
description: Ryan Pressly had no interest in waiting to see if the Astros would get the help they needed to clinch the last spot in the expanded American League playoffs after the Houston reliever couldn’t finish it himself when he was a strike away.

title: Walk away: Indians rally again, keep AL Central hopes alive
description: Once again, the Indians grabbed water bottles, poured from the dugout and danced around the infield grass like little kids at recess.

title: Clevinger gets shot, Padres hope he can pitch in playoffs
description: San Diego pitcher Mike Clevinger got a cortisone shot for his ailing right elbow Friday and the Padres are hopeful he'll be OK for the playoffs.

title: Astros magic number 1 for AL playoff spot after win at Texas
description: The Houston Astros are on the verge of clinching the American League's last playoff spot, powered by some of their mainstays in a breakout performance that certainly excited manager Dusty Baker.

title: Chirinos homers as Mets maintain playoff hopes, top Nats 3-2
description: Robinson Chirinos homered and drove in three runs, and the New York Mets beat the Washington Nationals 3-2 on Thursday night to keep their flickering postseason hopes alive.

title: Blue Jays clinch 1st playoff spot since 2016, beat Yanks 4-1
description: Hyun Jin Ryu pitched seven shutout innings and the Toronto Blue Jays clinched their first postseason spot since 2016, beating the Yankees 4-1 Thursday night and further damaging New York's chances of hosting a first-round playoff series.

title: MLB moving amateur draft to All-Star week in July
description: Major League Baseball is moving its amateur draft to the All-Star break beginning next season.

title: MLB teams find creative ways to stay energized without fans
description: The absence of fans didn't stop Cincinnati Reds first baseman Joey Votto from receiving an ovation after hitting a homer to put his team ahead for good.

title: Mattingly's Marlins could clinch berth at Yankee Stadium
description: Don Mattingly returns this weekend to the Bronx, where his best years as a player always ended when the regular season did.

title: Royals outfielder Alex Gordon to retire after season
description: Kansas City Royals outfielder Alex Gordon, the former first-round pick whose rollercoaster career took him from near bust to All-Star and Gold Glove winner, announced Thursday he will retire after the season.

title: Pirates prospect arrested in deadly Dominican Republic crash: report
description: Pittsburgh Pirates prospect Oneil Cruz was reportedly arrested in a deadly crash in the Dominican Republic on Monday.

title: Rays beat Mets 8-5, clinch 1st AL East title in 10 years
description: Confetti instead of champagne. Silly string instead of beer.

title: Bieber lowers ERA to 1.63, Indians top White Sox 3-2
description: Shane Bieber lowered his ERA to 1.63 in his final regular-season start, the lowest in the American League since Luis Tiant’s 1.60 for Cleveland in 1968, and Jordan Luplow hit a game-ending home run that gave the Indians a 3-2 win over Chicago on Wednesday night.

title: Clevinger suddenly pulled after 1 inning, Pads fall to Halos
description: The euphoria of clinching their first playoff berth in 14 seasons three days earlier was tempered for the San Diego Padres when right-hander Mike Clevinger was suddenly pulled after only one inning of his start Wednesday.

title: Dodgers clinch NL's top seed, West title with win over A's
description: Wrapping up an NL West title has become routine for the Los Angeles Dodgers, but in a year in which no one was sure three months ago if there would be a baseball season, manager Dave Roberts wanted his team to still savor the moment.

title: Ozuna, Braves beat Miami, clinch 3rd straight NL East title
description: Bryse Wilson pitched five scoreless innings, Marcell Ozuna drove in five runs with four hits that included two homers and the Atlanta Braves clinched their third straight NL East title by beating the Miami Marlins 11-1 on Tuesday night.

title: LHP Cole Hamels done for year after just 1 start for Braves
description: After making just one start for the Atlanta Braves, Cole Hamels is done for the season.

title: Seeding, not record determines who bats last in World Series
description: The higher seeded team reaching the World Series will have last at-bats in Games 1 and 2 and if needed Games 6 and 7, not necessarily the team with the best record.

title: Fan somehow sneaks into Fenway Park, seen screaming at top of Green Monster
description: A baseball fan did everything he could to catch the ending of the Boston Red Sox’s win over the New York Yankees on Sunday at Fenway Park.

title: Rally puts Padres back in playoffs for 1st time in 14 years
description: The San Diego Padres are returning to the playoffs for the first time in 14 years after beating the Seattle Mariners 7-4 Sunday with a three-run rally in the 11th inning that included a go-ahead double by newcomer Mitch Moreland.

title: Red Sox finally snap skid vs Yankees, who clinch spot anyway
description: Despite dismal results against the New York Yankees this season, at least the Boston Red Sox didn’t have to watch their longtime rivals enjoy clinching a playoff berth at Fenway Park.

title: Springer hits inside-the-park HR, Astros top D-backs 3-2
description: George Springer homered twice, including an inside-the-park shot, to lead the Houston Astros over the Arizona Diamondbacks 3-2 on Sunday.

title: Twins' Josh Donaldson elaborates on spat with umpire after ejection earlier in week
description: Minnesota Twins third baseman Josh Donaldson spoke out about his ejection during a game against the Chicago White Sox earlier in the week.

title: Happ, Frazier lift Yanks over Red Sox for 10th straight win
description: Less than two weeks removed from a slide that threatened to derail their season, the New York Yankees are on the cusp of another postseason berth.

title: Tigers' Ron Gardenhire abruptly retires before end of season
description: Detroit Tigers manager Ron Gardenhire abruptly retired Saturday with only a handful of games left in the season.

title: Longtime baseball pro scout Gary Hughes dies at 79
description: Gary Hughes, a beloved professional scout for numerous big league organizations during a 54-year career, has died in Northern California after a battle with cancer. He was 79.

title: Astros' Justin Verlander to have Tommy John surgery, out through 2021: 'Obviously, this is not good news'
description: Houston Astros pitcher Justin Verlander announced Saturday he will undergo Tommy John surgery and is expected to be out through the 2021 season.

title: Alex Rodriguez on Ruth Bader Ginsburg's death: 'You will be deeply missed by all'
description: Alex Rodriguez was among the current and former professional athletes who remembered Supreme Court Justice Ruth Bader Ginsberg after her death Friday night.

title: Pujols passes Mays for 5th on HR list with No. 661, adds 662
description: Los Angeles Angels slugger Albert Pujols passed Willie Mays for fifth place on the career home run list, hitting No. 661 on Friday night against Texas.

title: A's clinch playoff berth with win over Giants, Mariners loss
description: An AL West title will mean so much more than simply clinching a playoff berth given how the past two seasons have gone for the Oakland Athletics.

title: Rays earn AL playoff spot with doubleheader sweep of Orioles
description: Having clinched a return trip to the postseason, the Tampa Bay Rays marked the occasion with a subdued celebration on the field before heading to the clubhouse, where they slipped on hats and shirts that will serve as souvenirs of the accomplishment.

title: White Sox beat Twins 4-3 to clinch playoff spot
description: After clinching a postseason berth for the first time since 2008, the Chicago White Sox were low key during their on-field celebration.

title: Joe Buck, voice of NFL on Fox, learns he’ll join dad in Pro Football Hall of Fame
